DeAuw7A1kQ7Hhx9Dtv6LJg.text: A new branch in downtown Summerlin. We sat outside and the waiter is very attentive. The steak is tender and juicy and the red snapper is cooked to perfection, not dry at all. It was not so busy and it's good for celebrating birthday or occasion. I haven't tried any other food but the snapper and steak and so far it is delicious. Ask the waiter to take few photos of you or group and they will gladly do it. Definitely a place to go back to.

photos.caption: Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. For fish lover so enjoyed this dish. Not dry at all.
Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. This is definitely a choice to get. It&#39;s delicious.

DMVNVjWGCSbywoFyKL8f5w.text: I'd prefer to leave a 3.5 star because I'm basing my review as someone who prefers not to eat meat with every meal. Their options for meatless meals are very limited and the ones they do have are fried. They happy hour per their sign is from 3pm to close which is great and their menu for is ok. They have two house wines (Cabernet  and Chardonnay) which were decent. The food option for happy hour were a disappointment so we chose to only have drinks and move on to the next place. The environment is really clean and modern however it's quite warm inside. Everyone once in a while someone would walk by and cause a breeze thankfully.

coDK7YcdTmMePeCcscW_KQ.text: Dining at Wolfgang Puck was a very pleasant experience. Our waiter James was excellent and made recommendations for my wife and I as it was our first time dining there. The calamari was excellent and our main dishes were delicious as well. James kept my cup full of the Moscow mules. We will definitely return.

photos.caption: Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu back
Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Menu front

K8fW2ASJBtwpPSdZ42S1QA.text: I've lunched here twice -- the first time was fantastic the second was marginal. Both times I had the salmon, which was good, as was the white bean ragout, green bean, and tomato side. This time there were some unidentifiable plants mixed in with the arugula salad.  One in our party sent the Chinese chicken salad back -- it was more of a spicy slaw with a chicken garnish than the entree salad with a protein serving we had on our first visit. The waiter was gracious with the substitute, but it throws off the timing of a meal to wait for a replacement.

J0M630SMR9i-vNLpzXbArg.text: Ordered for weeknight evening dinner: -calamari (would be great to have another dip option) -bacon wrapped meatloaf special (good flavor, grilled meatloaf slices) -burger & fries (ordered extra crispy fries, still soggy) Total w/ Tip $60+  *other - bathroom was nice, but toilet paper had silver covers that you have to lift, both were empty...such a fail when I have to resort to seat covers to wipe up.  Quantity and Quality do not justify the prices of these items here. Service was great however, but having to pay the price we paid for a dinner for 2 that we can get at better prices and quality at CF, you can definitely find better elsewhere. Glad to have crossed off the list...

khI8kviD1Nd56Rk6rWr_GA.text: Our waiter, Ricky, was amazing!!! So attentive and knowledgeable of the menu and drinks. Super nice guy! We sat on the patio and it was beautiful out, the atmosphere was great and the food and drinks were delicious.

2DbvuvP6hcSBRJfZDPywjw.text: One of my favorite places in Summerlin. Great food and service. On nice days, sit on the patio.

WTXuCTHGHYB3ZlIH2cq_Ug.text: Staff seem like deer in headlights. Not friendly.  Food is ok over priced. Don't get me wrong  I don't mind paying for good service and good food.  So yeah it's eh.  Not impressed.

tEB-R8E9ybf-sZpdc1DulQ.text: I've eaten at Wolfgang Puck restaurants in Los Angeles and Las Vegas.  The food here was good - up to standard.  The service wasn't.   I arrived 3p for a late, leisurely lunch.  The bar was occupied by 3 other guests but the remaining spots were dirty - dishes and place mats from previous occupants.   I took one of these spots and the bartender (working furiously) assured me he would clean it shortly.  I left 90 minutes later and all 3 additional bar diners got the same experience.  They sat at dirty seats and waited quite a while for service.  Where was the manager???   Once I got to order, the food came quickly and it was delicious.  But my experience (leisurely lunch) was punctuated by a bartender constantly on the run, waiting on everyone in the restaurant and working furiously to keep up.  Getting his attention was difficult because he was so busy, but he was also extremely polite once caught.   Whomever manages this location was content to let him flounder for an hour and a half this afternoon while patrons paid the price.  Not a great experience, especially specially at a chain that prides itself on delivering an exceptional customer experience.

Oje_BiLfPmlwTr1ks48FPA.text: It's just bad!  We went here for thanksgiving dinner and when I made the reservations they said the cost would be $29 per person for the Turkey dinner and that one plate would probably be enough for two.  Well, the cost was $33.00 per person, the plate was skimpy and I could not eat the turkey,  The service was very poor.  Our server was very inattentive.  We had to ask for things like bread a couple of times.  I would not recommend this restaurant.

V3yLfIE1gGWQS9rR0b9vYA.text: Went there with my wife on Friday night 11/4 around 8:00 pm. Place was crowded but we got a seat. After 10 minutes, I had to flag down the manager to take our order. My wife ordered a glass of wine and the manager poured it in her glass and spilled it on the table in the process. I was washing my hands in the bathroom at the time this happened. I flagged down our server and asked if she could please get me a towel so I could wipe up the mess. She said OK, but never came back. I had to flag down the manager again and ask for a new napkin because I used mine to wipe up the mess. Food was good but expensive. 2 apps, 1 glass of wine and one entree was $69.00.  This is the 2nd time we came here  and the last time we left after 10 minutes because no one came to take our order.  This is probably the last time we come here.  Too many other choices.

H3A5JeDYy-NxIKBjjRWILQ.text: Very disappointed in tonight's dinner and service. Server stopped by twice - take our order and deliver the bill. Pizza was burnt! Manager took the pizza off the tab. Unlikely we'll return any time soon.

photos.caption: Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. If you like your pizza &#34;well done &#34; - this is the place for you!

Yyh2QBJ6Ad2Hsn4NheWiYg.text: The most over-priced salad (16.00) for 1.5 cups of greens and 3 oz of chicken. when I commented the server got surly, offered to bring me more, but never did. Tables are so close together, you feel like your neighbors can hear your every word.  Out on this place.

QRyBjjMOnMG0ox64mu6qxg.text: Great spot up in the Summerlin area. Food has always been great and service is always on point. Was just told that the Happy Hour now ends at 7pm. One of the many reasons the wife and I would make any excuse to come here. Well, guess we'll just have to come and catch it if we're here at the right time.  Update: Near the end of our visit, we were awaiting for our server to come check on is again. I wanted a refill on my ice tea and the wife was looking forward to another sangria. Well, needless to say we didn't see our server again until another 30 minutes (or so) and by that time, we were just ready to leave. We flagged down the hostess and voiced our concern and then a few minutes later a manager came and spoke with us. We were going to just brush it off but since we've been coming here I figured they should be offered the opportunity to know and be able to fix it. Again, food is good and the service is always great but that evening our server just gave us the impression that they wanted nothing to do with us. I hope their management gets it together and soon.

PEfsc4ET39ThKZC-oOUasw.text: Bad. Second time is the last time.   Our first visit was a few months ago and indecision brought us back after a lackluster first experience. We shared the homemade chips with blue cheese dip on visit numerous uno. They weren't great, the "dip" was more like old mayo in a bowl with a sprinkle of blue cheese.  This visit was worse, I ordered the chopped vegetable salad with chicken. In my opinion 22.00 for a small salad with carrots, celery and a few tomatoes is absurd.  The chicken didn't actually come on my salad, I had to ask for it showed up  third of the way into brunch.  My boyfriend ordered the wolf "Mac" muffin. Greasy, gross and child size. Also, comes with no sides so after adding avocado he paid 16.00 for a sandwich that he could have gotten at McDonald's for a dollar.  Service was not great, our waiter disappeared and we basically were shuffled through the rest of the servers. When our server shows back up he refilled my mimosa and hanged me a soaking wet glass with a "sorry" about spilling juice and bubbles all over it. This is a non issue, people spill things but at 80.00 for brunch the service should be close to impeccable.

JKmU3xnRTywXGnDK3z_XYQ.text: I like this area but this WP wasn't good. Ordered pizza. Too much sauce and crust was not light, airy with a slight chew like the one at the MGM. Hubby ordered seafood pasta. Wasn't fresh. Seafood tasted fishy. Service was good but will stick to the one at MGM.

iCNCZkldwagWnXZ1eCD-Nw.text: Stopped for lunch and was extremely pleased- Ordered a pizza and got my daughter some Mac and cheese-  could tell everything was fresh and made to order.   Staff was very friendly and attentive without being over bearing.  Environment was clean and relaxing.  A bit loud due to openness and the modern industrial style but also due to being slightly busy. Loved the open kitchen design and bar feature areas

4aj433Q8FUZrNm010OVfcA.text: Love patio seating, great food and service.  Definitely will be dining here again in the future.

2bFxKKmp2anwygLtiBm2Rg.text: The food was great, the service was suspect at first, but then really picked up for the second half of the meal and the decor is superb!   So the food: everything we had was very good! The truffle potato chips are a delicious app! I know! I typically don't order chips for an app, but the waitress recommended them...so we obliged. She was spot on with the recommendation! They were hot and crispy with a delicious truffle/cheese sauce on top! We all sat around and talked while picking at them! Our second app was the Tuna Tartare and it was equally as delicious! Obviously they are at completely opposite ends of the spectrum, but it was very good in its own right!   The service was a little snooty at first, but she really warmed up after we ordered our apps. By the end of our meal I really enjoyed her service!   The decor is industrial/shabby chic and I loved everything about it! The green glasses were amazing! Lol I know it doesn't really matter, but I enjoyed it!   Overall it was a very good place and I will most certainly be back!

photos.caption: Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Lemon poppy seed!
Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Outdoor seating

e7lV6B-lEC5A5KsfWSpYZQ.text: For this type of restaurant, I've only had great to excellent food and excellent service. The only complaint I have is that they keep changing the menu and they get rid of their best dishes. Maybe they aren't selling that well, so their cancelation is justified, but people need to get more adventurous and try things out if that's the case. They had a roast beef sandwich that was so tender and perfectly seasoned that I'm extremely surprised it was cancelled.   I've been here several times and always 5 stars!

5Q_k6Wes54vJifYVtANbPw.text: I was just wondering if it is a good thing that the head chef or sous chef is standing where the orders are coming out and he's actually standing there eating something off a plate while everyone in the restaurant can see him?  Shouldn't he be eating a meal away from the food line?

n6PbU4xsqInkI6CxholUYA.text: Beautiful atmosphere! I ordered the toasted vegetable pizza. The servers are super nice and friendly. Id say come dressed nicely. I came in a sweater and felt a little out of place

rtwCqdwMygGN1W4WbkaH8Q.text: DTS salad is amazing! I also enjoy the chips with blue cheese. Food is a little pricey but it's pretty good and this place has a great atmosphere.

lKK8ghWZE8bzQOhLb6SykA.text: We don't need another food joint like this one, employees stuck up and most of cooks are hang out at the dining area and cursing at customers.  Night and day, compare to one in Crystal on strip.  We need some place we can be happy not struggle with their employees. We are not there to work with their employees.

IfgqTdJBc7DGRrUhGYW1jQ.text: I sat up at the bar and ordered a Manhattan, a side of potatoes, and the ahi tuna appetizer. All were very delicious. It was expensive, but not overwhelmingly so for Vegas. The only thing I'd say about this experience was that it was very clear to me that all of the bartenders were about to get off shift...and were making their anticipation/happiness of this very evident to everyone. If you dont want to be there, I dont want to hear it.

QRHi78ZP4RkEcccwFAicmA.text: Just want to say Pucks is an amazing place to eat. Sarah the manager and Juan the servers are the best. Great food, at great prices.

YmzY3JVTRCVBLaccTgVQZQ.text: Gianna was the very best guide to our Wolfgang excursion. She is a doll. Hope you get her!!xxoxoxox

Xq6mObFR0_u8pNCLDWwxUg.text: I ordered their chicken salad sandwich. It was good but disappointed to discover the toasted bread was burnt on one side and was hidden inside the sandwich. I mentioned it to the waitress. Her response was disappointing. She basically confirmed it was burnt. Yeah.. Thanks I can see that.

H082e-tL-WhlJT4QBw9M6Q.text: I would give it a zero. Their time said they close at 10, I arrive with a party of 6 at 9:10 and they said they were closed. Guess they don't want my money. Lost customers forever.

qwrUfTPbfYZ00v-14qYAlg.text: I Never have written a review for any restaurants in Las Vegas, or any where for that matter. My Girlfriend who is in remission from Cancer and this was her first outing, she decided she wanted to try this place out. When we arrived we were greeted by the "hostess" and I use that term very loosely because a hostess is the first one to make the experience great. She sat us down near the kitchen, now please keep in mind my friend is very sensitive to smells unfortunately , and the smell was an over powering fish smell that was coming from the kitchen. So we asked if we can move (and pointed to another table that was vacant) to another table, she said no. Then we asked again if its possible to be moved to any other table that wasn't near the kitchen , and when I tell you there were many open tables, she stated again "no" and not in a kind way of any manner.  Unfortunately we never were able to try the food because the "customer service" that wasn't  available, when we walked she clearly saw us and smirked and giggled under her breath. I would never go back just because of the rudeness of staff, and would recommended several of the other restaurants in downtown Summerlin.

rAWuTHrH15wcZISoOf4yiQ.text: Food is delicious.  But the service is atrocious and the bartenders need to work on their skills when making cocktails. We have eaten here on a weekly basis for the last several months.  No one knows us and there seems to be a lot of turn over in staff and managers.  Fingers crossed they can pull it together because we really do love the menu.

Jp5UCV573OVwuiYf8Ylr0A.text: I was very disappointed in this restaurant.  If you are looking for a quiet restaurant-forget it with this place.  It was very loud and the service was slow.  The food was very average.  The waiter came by various tables and offered artisan bread, along with olive oil for dipping, as bread was not placed on the tables.  After taking one piece, the waiter asked us if we liked the bread and proceeded to state, if we did, then we could purchase it and pointed to the area where they were selling the bread.  For a restaurant of this size and the name-Wolfgang Puck, I would expect to have a small portion placed at each table.  There are far better places to dine in Las Vegas, and Wolfgang Puck Bar and Grill won't be one of them for me.

OGWfAtC_yXag37c_anPz1A.text: Food five star, service 3 star hence the 4 stars.  Everything we had, (enjoyed Restaurant Week Menu) including the brick chicken, pizza with mozz-and red sauce, tortilla soup, and a salted caramel sugar cookie dessert was so tasty and flavorful.  Service did drop the ball. We were seated and were approached by a waiter who introduced himself and said he would be back shortly. 7 minutes later another server came over and without any explanation took over. She was wonderful throughout and was very helpful. The runners is where the service gaffs occurred. We did not get new silverware between courses and the worst gaff came when the runner delivered the desserts during the MIDDLE of our enjoying our main course. He didn't offer to clear, just dropped the dishes and again no silverware was replenished. The waitress saw it after the fact and apologized but didn't take the desserts back, just left them there.  We Definitely felt rushed. The restaurant wasn't full.

5PZSMc3WLnEJePzNLD9T7g.text: Can't believe some review.. How people can compare this restaurant to California Pizza Chicken.. How can you compare Cysco Food and Homemade food made by real chef with passion.. Everybody can see the difference between fake tomato sauce and fresh tomato sauce, same for every product used in their kitchen, you can feel it in your plate..  Great restaurant : -menu change very often -great service, not the typical fine dining service, just a very friendly service by professional waiter -family friendly menu with very good Homemade option for kid (no chicken finger from the freezer) -honest price  You must try...

kxj_Nx55POF4PqF11l3TNA.text: Not sure on the reasoning for some of the poor reviews but this is one of the better meals in Downtown Summerlin. Nice relaxed atmosphere, clean, good quality dishes at a reasonable price point. I've been here for all 3 meals and they have all been good.

uXI3h_IA0BSWTZyW86oKfQ.text: I ate at Wolfgangs with my family this week and I have to say I was not impressed. 2 stars for the food, an extra star for the service. Here's what we had Mushroom pasta with marscapone- the pasta is VERY al dente- all of it! Very little flavor from this dish.. I didn't even eat half of it. Burger with a marmalade of some kind (only one on the menu)- it was just ok. Burger was cooked perfectly, veggies were fresh and bun was soft but it just wasn't great.  Mac n cheese- like I said previously, very al dente... Almost crunchy and the cheese sauce was very thin. Topped with bread crumbs though, so that was nice. Kids cheese pizza- best meal of the table. Crust has a really great sourdough taste and is nice and crispy.   Service was very personal and very attentive. My server let me try 3 wines before choosing the one I wanted. She also took my uneaten mushroom pasta off of my bill without me asking, which is always nice.

aqyQf0USEb61XsWBrAuNxA.text: food is good.  service is nice.  when the weather is good, dining outside is very pleasant.

oF27k2YsOwGbe22CBj6Xuw.text: Food was fine but the perfectly pleasant waitress forgot one of the main courses. Our friend declined her offer to quickly get it made and instead ordered just a side of fries. I was surprised to see that she charged us for them after her error, low rent behavior for this kind of place.

2HvCmp_sXpyeaBxv63YlHg.text: One of Vegas' best restaurants.  We were long-time fans of Chef Mark, and we were so pleased when he moved to our part of town to open this restaurant.  Everything they cook is creative and delicious, even the humblest fare, like burgers and pizza.  Truffled potato chips with blue cheese.  Roasted baby beets with toasted pistachios.  Hand-cut pappardelle with oxtail ragout.  Just thinking about it makes my mouth water.  The service is impeccable without being pretentious.  Casual meals, date nights, or business luncheons, this restaurant always delivers.

WwhF-UD8r2ZgwbDrTthK0A.text: The food is good but the service is terrible!  The rating is more about the service, or lack of, than the food.  I expect a lot more than the server to come take your order and bring you your food and check with no attention in between.  The dos took forever to come out and nobody came by to even check-in or apologize for the delay.  Just unacceptable period.

OLxj3EMTIWRWU--MVgAB8w.text: The food was good. I ordered the halibut and the cauliflower and it was very tasty. The service was SLOW. We waited a long time to order and for the server to take our plates and bring the bill.  Not sure why because the restaurant was basically empty.

photos.caption: Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

iKikf1LGR8-HXDN0t2L0RA.text: The so-called New England Clambake was one of the poorest executed events that I have ever attended. The food was mediocre but the service and execution were absolutely horrible. Not only will I never go to another event here but I will probably never go to another Wolfgang Puck restaurant again.  Wolfgang's celebrity star has lost it's shine.

XEtywO72WHcNPlPY3P8Reg.text: Always a great meal at Puck in DTS! Ourfave place to eat delicious food! Tonight-salmon en papillote, meatballs and roasted cauliflower. Best service and Ian, mamager, always takes great care of us!

7uVBTBM7uz7yZmvK8iSWSw.text: Great food. Great Happy Hour. Everything I've tried has been delicious and the services is great specially Rachelle at the bar very friendly and always with a smile.

UpT4f2hVtGjB1ha1k55D5w.text: Really Good Food and Service, Served by Alex. There other servers were excellent as well. Great Wine List To. Will be returning !!!

lAJtXNVLK3-DARrJdiOyoA.text: The food and service was so amazing!    I went in on a weekday evening for dinner and was greeted by very friendly hosts.  I was seated right away at a great table with a view of the open kitchen.  My server, Cassandra, came over to great me right away and was so nice.  She was bubbly and very efficient.  I ordered the butternut squash soup to begin and it has to be the best one I had every tasted.  They garnish it with petipa and fried sage.  Yum!  Then I ordered the filet mignon for my main course and it was cooked to perfection and so juicy.  I would definitely come here again and I think I would request to sit in Cassandra's section again!  Bravo!

uc2fhUL9DYKmSJWtxwJIkA.text: Rachel is the best at her job and deserves to prosper in the Wolf Gang Puck organization!  Happy Holidays  Frequent Visitor and fan of Wolf Gang

fBzMq7tL96N6mWzrWuCwjA.text: This place is awesome!! Came in on Sunday for lunch and Cassandra was our server and she was outstanding!! She helped me pick out a yummy white wine call complicated Chardonnay to go with my Chinese chicken salad. Cassandra was so attentive and professional we'll be back to see her again! She gave us a great experience.

Gwp59MVAVVeacJIrnb5T4Q.text: I ordered the braised short ribs and they were pretty darn good. However considering the price and service I'm giving it a 4 star which is still good, but not too notch for me. Being a Wolfgang location and also in Vegas you're paying for the name. Our server was pretty good but didn't check on us very much and that surprised me as it wasn't that busy and it is a little higher end location. The service wasn't bad just would expect a little more attention.  I also ordered the Nutella skillet cake and it was average. The consistency was soft and gooey which was nice but I didn't feel there was much more taste than when I eat Nutella out of the jar. One thing I think they should change is to allow their happy hour to extend from the bar area into the restaurant itself. The cocktail I had was also average and to be expected pricey. I would go back here but I feel like there are other places where I can get amazing food at cheaper price points.

Y8p0xy2ccpRxFecwp33ueQ.text: That place was amazing restaurant but since they been so many different stuff not proper training is very.bad As the  bartender attitude men late 20 beard and like to talk with the employees he doesn't care about the guest plus his attitude is bad I will never go back not even recommend it horrible sincerely ALEX L.

KAmAGe4Lo0SecEWeGTC90A.text: My husband and I ordered from the Restaurant Week menu and we were very happy with our choices.  He ordered the Baja Shrimp ceviche, kind of like a shrimp Bloody Mary, the BeefShort Ribs, and the Peach Crumble cheesecake. Great shrimp, light, tasty; the ribs were a very good portion and very tender; and the dessert was delicious.  One note - not enough peaches on the cheesecake!    I ordered the Apple Endive Salad which was just a lovely mix of flavors and very light; the Grilled Trout - so fresh and seasoned well; and the Pretzel Caramel Tart which was like a chocolate/caramel candy bar with vanilla ice cream - large portion so I would recommend sharing this one.  Good service, great food and a nice atmosphere.  Only complaint was there was music playing and that typically amps up the noise level along with the place being very full on a Friday night.

QyrvAK6qMS1XU9dUnOfRww.text: I picked this spot for a dinner with a coworker after she requested a place in the downtown Summerlin area. I got a bad feeling when I looked over their menu and nothing interested me, but I was confident that the several positive reviews from friends would yield a good experience.  Started with a glass of the Wolfgang Puck Cab, $9 and delicious, as well as the truffle chips with bleu cheese fondue. The truffle was a little overstated but the fondue had good flavor- too bad the order was cold.   Coworker ordered the brick chicken and broccoli, while I chose the tortilla soup and roasted squash. Neither of us were wowed, food was very generic. I can't help but think I ordered wrong, but nothing stood out on the menu and even looking through reviews and photos now, the pizza that gets the best reviews (potato and leek with proscuitto?) is no longer available.

photos.caption: Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Receipt

rJHRoxwDZDQS7cTT796sVw.text: Outstanding service. Great food, as one might expect from a Wolfgang Puck restaurant. I always had the steak. My server heard about my bad day and offered me a glass of champagne because I couldn't decide between champagne and Pinot Noir.   One downside is they always close early. But the location in MGM is open til 6am!

Qa88H6rn9WdkKbB2n48lFg.text: Our food came out hot and fresh but I think it wasn't worth the money. The portion of the calamari was quite small. Although I really love their Chicken Nachos. It was delicious and very filling. My husband said it was ok. I also ordered Jameson and Ginger Ale. The bartender put too much whiskey and not enough ginger so it was too strong. I ordered iced tea the second round so that was good for me.   Overall, Happy Hour was good. It's a busy place with friendly service.

hk1Wt1V0Z_iqxkCWVS12Kg.text: 20% off with Yelp checkin. Food was tasty, but a bit pricey compared to others in Downtown Summerlin so the Yelp discount was appreciated! Next time I'm trying happy hour, 3-7 daily. Dog friendly patio outside the bar!

7U7lqT3e8lf2SNua3KgrXQ.text: The food here is hit or miss. Sometimes the food is really delicious and other times the food is like eating at Chili's. I think it depends what cook you get that day. Other then the spotty food the service is excellent. I usually eat her about 3-4 times a year but there are a lot better options at DTS such as Public School.

o5Ytwd4r40vinN3H8-pKRg.text: Came here tonight again for dinner because we had such a great dinner last time and yet again we had another awesome dining experience.   THE FOOD: Dish 1:  Rigatoni pasta Turkey Bolognese. Best dish we had tonight. So good. Loved the whipped Basil Ricotta in the middle.   Dish 2: Pork Snitziel. This dish was also very good. Big portions. The mustard sauce completed the taste of this filling dish.   Dish 3:  Salmon. Mom really loved it and said she would order it again when she comes back.   Dish 4: My sister got the Pasta Di Orecchiette. Very good pasta dish. Perfect mix of meat and veggies.   Dish 5: Mac and Cheese for my niece. It was so so. Not cheesy enough.   THE SERVICE: Zoe was our server tonight. She was very helpful and courteous. Didn't have to ever wait too long for anything. And Brad the manager was also very hospitable and treated our table well.   Had a great dinner tonight. Definitely recommend for anyone who wants to come to eat good food and have great service. The sports playing on the tv's at the bar is an additional plus!

photos.caption: Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Crispy Pork Schnitzel
Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Pasta Orecchiette
Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mac and Cheese.

tac_dr-25mwGDGpHtChJnw.text: This is a review for the Wolfgang Puck Happy Hour  The space and ambiance are amazing - open, trendy, and has outdoor spacing. The space is new so super comfortable and the area is walkable.  I am a sucker for prosecco...and their $5 happy hour prosecco really can't be beat! One of the better proseccos I've tried, all for a whopping $5.  There are 7 food options under $10 for happy hour.  The pizza is on the smaller size (looks like a personal pan pizza) but everything else is shareable and tasty.    On top of all this, check in on Yelp or scan your TruFusion ID for an additional 20% off!  The only only only thing that would make this a 5 star was if the pizza was better and if they added $1 oysters on the menu =D

JtWa-3d4k0Hz10I5WZ0KFQ.text: Food: Hit or miss Beer Selection: Pleasantly surprising  Brand: Starting to become questionable  Service: Much to be desired  Spaghetti & meatballs had a half delicious side and a half scorching, spicy, and dry.  Braised short ribs tasted decent but was just so ugly to look at.   Appetizers were on par with basic bar food.  Best part was the Trappist beer..   Slow, disorganized, borderline pompous, and lost most points because they brought my kids juice 3/4 of the meal through accompanied by a series of excuses. Oh and where was the two order of bread we ordered? I'm sure there was an excuse for that too but I can't recall. I think my last good WGP experience was at the LAX airport. Will keep to our usual spots at DT Summerlin.

UvcHGhQlHzlTvURwP6S4ug.text: Been here a few times whenever I visit family for holidays. I have had some good times and others a bit on the lower hand so I'll just be giving 3 stars. Let's start with the bad, the bartender named Brie, short for Brianna possibly, was rude and constant a Debbie downer trying to one up everyone she speaks to. I guess the customer isn't always right. The management is a complete 50/50 as well where you get one good manager and one bad, good cop bad cop I suppose just not enough good. There's a female who does walk around like she's in control but to be honest I don't even think she knows what's she's doing. Followed by the next one, Ian, I remember his name because he feels he has to be the loud one at all times in the dining area. Never greeted us, but ladies if you're between 19-23 years old you'll have all his attention. I honestly don't know if it's because he's gay, which I have no disrespect to seeing as I was raised by two mothers so none meant, or he just really wants to try and get every females number.   Now the good. Auggie the manager such a damn heart of gold as well as the chefs who actually came and spoke for a second and said hello. The drinks are always on point especially the damn old fashioned they make, can't remember the bartender who made it but she was sweet and great always smiling from ear to ear even if she looks like she isn't 21 but she is. To the other bartenders and not to mention the man named Mark. He has his own food truck which he cooks free meals for those in need. Hearts of gold these people.   I am moving back to the east coast but maybe in the future I may be able to visit once it's fixed and the management learns how to actually be managers and not pre teen 32 year olds.   -Brian

8vEO4-Mvd6ZBxFZIWf7dfw.text: Great food  Great prices Half price on bottle of wine for dinner Fish and chips was really good. Yum yum

dZ5on_Uio5MpIaxf_s45nQ.text: I think we got to the restaurant when the shift change was happening, a first server came to our table and asked us for our drink order and if we had questions about the menu, she never came back.   Later, a second server came in to take our drink order again, our drinks took well over 15 minutes to get there, mind you, restaurant was empty.  Food was decent but service was very lackluster, non attentive and going through the motions. Hopefully it was just a bad night.  We'll think about it twice before coming back.

KONQmGiCUjAiHN4rfRGviQ.text: Straightforward - Great food, Awesome service, late night coctails white wine sagria is my way to end a great night.  If your in the mood for a tasty pasta spaghetti with meatballs this is one stop to do. My picture should sum it all for to you.

photos.caption: Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

lh32Mc3_lNn0JK7QQPZVyA.text: We went here for dinner this evening. We were a party of seven. We were seated at two tables, one of which was incredibly small. The $5 mai tai's were good. The food was just ok. Nothing spectacular. The burgers came with frozen fries. I would expect a Wolfgang restaurant to use fresh. I had the Chinese chicken salad which was quite tasty but a small portion for $16 not to mention it only had five to six minuscule pieces of chicken. My husband had the salmon. An approximately 4 oz piece served with a large amount of leafy greens for $27. The portion for rigatoni bolognese was a small portion as well for the $22 charged.  The portion sizes are disproportionate to the cost. The service wasn't anything special either. It was slow and our server wasn't very attentive to our party. She was tending the bar as well. Unfortunately, we won't be going back. Just all around lack luster food and just ok service.

CoysY2q7mjBt9fZKbiLe8w.text: The pizza and salad were wonderful. The crispy crust and cheesy balance were perfect! They had some of the most attentive staff in this area!

dP_FoEtojHRHeCqr02A9KA.text: This is one of my favorite whenever restaurants. They change the pastas that they make from scratch and everyone I've tried, I have loved. Their pizzas are really good too. Salads are fresh. Their cookies are delicious! I've brought family and friends and they all of it!

T4GQWDy61cDh0uTAa1QnHQ.text: They were very busy when I arrived at lunchtime and was seated fairly quickly despite a mix up over my reservation, which I later realized was my fault. We counted 30 plus staff, about 1:1 ratio to the customers dining inside. No doubt just for the opening until things get settled.   The focaccia bread was nice and my Summerlin Sour was a nice, tasty drink without being too strong, which was fine since it was lunchtime. The recc'd truffled potato chips w bleu cheese fondue was way too salty for me and not strong enough bleu cheese. We asked for the mac n cheese instead and were graciously accommodated. The pasta was fine and al dente, but the sauce was a bit bland and runny. More importantly, the crock it came in was barely lukewarm; mac n cheese should always be hot! We gently pointed this out and our waitress immediately said it would not be on our bill.  For the entrees, my partner loved his hamburger and two bites of it showed me that it was cooked perfectly med rare (although actually, he wasn't asked how he'd like it), very juicy, and flavorful. My pappardelle w oxtail ragout was also al dente but the thickness was a bit too heavy handed and there was very little oxtail. But because the service was so on point, they had just opened, and the burger was so tasty, I am awarding 4 stars and will be back next week to give them another shot!

7-mH0MMohBuGRVRFoKJ7cQ.text: We went for dinner on a Sunday night. The appetizer came out before our drink order. We had to flag down a bus boy to ask where our drinks were.  This was the theme for the night, order drinks and wait 20 minutes. I ordered the burger because $38 is ridiculous for a hanger steak. The burger was cooked properly and a good size.  The problem was it was so salty that I couldn't finish the burger. It was my first experience with Wolfgang Puck and was probably my last. It left me with a sore stomach and wondering why it's popular.

TCTiWKhG1Q17VLQJHnxHJQ.text: It upsets me to have to post this scathing review, but people need to know that the staff as well as the manager at this fine establishment are racist, and they employ discriminatory practices in order to keep minorities out...allow me to expound...my friends and I, (all black)decided to go to Wolfgang Puck in Summerlin after enjoying dinner elsewhere in the plaza. After being seated, we were quickly told by Lauren that no outside food was allowed. I let her know that we would not be eating the food (I and another member of our party had bagged, to-go orders with us from the restaurant we had previously dined at). Lauren said that it did not matter that we were not eating it because any outside food was against Wolfgang Puck's policies. She said, "so, I could throw it away" we, of course, decided to leave rather than allow her to throw our food away. We sat by an outside fire nearby the restaurant, and we continued our evening. To my dismay about 10 minutes later a white man and his friend entered the restaurant with bags of takeout...my friends and I watched in disbelief as the man took a seat by the bar, and began ordering drinks! At no time did anyone approach this man and his friend to let them know that outside food was not allowed. I decided to go speak with the restaurant manager about the unequal treatment my friends and I had received. Chelsea (the manager) and Lauren (the hostess) proceeded to pretend (unconvincingly) that they had not seen the man and his companion enter with bags of takeout. They then went on to lie and say that the man's food had been thrown away; the food was still sitting on the bar! When we let the two women know that the food was still on the bar, Chelsea and Lauren suddenly remembered that the restaurant offers patrons the option of placing outside food on the counter. This realization came as news to my friends and me because placing our food on a counter was not an option that was offered to us. Our options were to throw our food away or to leave. It is a shame that in 2016 there are establishments that continue to employ discriminatory policies in an effort to keep the patrons that they desire in and the patrons that they find less than desirable out! I should not have to say this, but my friends and I are all young, black professionals. We have more degrees among us than there were people in our group. I will never step foot inside of another Wolfgang Puck restaurant. Racism is alive and well in 2016! SHAME ON YOU WOLFGANG PUCK!

photos.caption: Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

gNp6GF7GbZGxrC6FcJJ_uw.text: Staff is always attentive and never let my drinks go untopped!  The food is very fresh...especially the pasta dishes.  Request the bread it is warm and tasty.  Always check out the rotating dessert menu...if you have a sweet tooth.  It won't disappoint. Great rustic and mid century modern decor.

4efmQ8UvxTwanLlznEp3tA.text: I've dined here several times since they've opened. I can't say I've had a bad experience. The service can be spotty, but generally it's pretty decent.  I agree that the menu is limited, but I believe most people should be able to find something to enjoy. I've tried a variety of items:  The burger (good) Spaghetti and meatballs (very good - homemade pasta that is, yes, cooked al dente) Half rotisserie chicken - tasty, and I'm not a huge chicken fan Special BLT type of sandwich at lunch - EXCELLENT  I've also heard from other diners that all of pasta dishes on the menu are very good.  The only dessert I've tried is the pineapple upside down cake, and it's been good.  For a non-alcoholic treat, try their Ginger-Lime Iced Tea. It's amazing!  The wine list is more limited than I would like, but I suppose it matches the menu variety. :)  The atmosphere is nice, the front desk staff is always super-friendly, and the location is really convenient for me. I do consider this one of my regular local restaurants and recommend you give it a try.

9h1lW1JB8764_7OjclYWHw.text: Place was alright. All items we got were awesome!  I really liked the gazpacho! My Wife really enjoyed the truffle oil/blue cheese chips.

fvFdYgBiE5uie0gLPf9JjA.text: This place exceeded my expectations. The food was amazing, great service and I loved the atmosphere. I will def be back ! I would recommend anyone here even if it's just for drinks or food it's all amazing.

KheO1iWpQt30yZCjVv9Zhg.text: I have been here multiple times for brunch and dinner and have always had a great experience. The food is exactly what you would expect from a Wolfgang Puck establishment - fresh, delicious and beautifully presented. The service I've received has always been warm and pleasant and I will definitely be back! We had brunch last week on the patio and it was lovely,I had the breakfast burrito and my boyfriend had the huevos rancheros. Both were very good. We have also had the burger here before and it's delicious. Great neighborhood place for healthy and delicious food.

YogVoFJ9P4JrxmEiIkpX4Q.text: This is getting one star because they are good at making substitutions for allergies and diet restrictions. Other than that the food is super expensive for not very good quality. I was starving after I finished my meal since the chicken was mostly skin, bones, and fat. No one in our group was happy with their food but at least it was edible.

vDQM1JLOAB_SB58IMzHltQ.text: This was my first time eating at a Wolfgang Puck restaurant and the experience was lovely! The food was fresh & delicious, well-prepared, & reasonably priced. Definitely gourmet style but in a more casual setting. Service was excellent too!

photos.caption: Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Double espresso!
Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple crostata with vanilla bean gelato!
Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fresh pressed green juice!

mWE5ZVkm6iGeQI3A-SN0Bg.text: Calamari with shisito peppers- delicious. I had the brick chicken - great flavor and cooked well. Generous wine pours, too! Excellent service and lively atmosphere.

4GN3B1toUBiSyV9Oc7T3rA.text: Happened to go by for lunch again when family was in town recently.  The first experience there was no fluke.  This place is on point.  And they have George T Stagg bourbon!  Just when I thought it couldn't get any better.

1Xit5SDrZD7m_xRVs-P9hA.text: We get the Mexican Street Corn and Crispy Cauliflower sides for Happy Hour!!! Awesome

S_8tGMhu24TkyHrmdTaoOA.text: Me and the family were looking a place to sit outside and this was the place to pick!! We waited no longer than 15 minutes.  My stepmom and I had asked about the complimentary mimosas and even though I didn't get a brunch item he still gave me the mimosa!  Great service. As for the food, AMAZING! I got the mesquite grilled burger cooked medium. Best burger I've had in awhile! Can't wait to try this place out again.

photos.caption: Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The mesquite grilled burger!!!

FenfzPZUmjj2nMCvpP6bGA.text: 4th visit and I want to say I sort of regular by now. WP is the pnly restaurant in my opinion that is doing great food at downtown summerlin. Ive been to them all.  Great feel to the restaurant, but not too busy. Pretty sad actually.  If I had one request it would be to bring back the shishito peppers. Other than that, I look forward to my next visit.

DEV5DPnJqbMTgsfIXJZmjg.text: Just a couple of drinks on the patio on a Friday afternoon. The have non alcoholic beer which is all I drink. Patio is in a good spot with good people watching. Service was very friendly and not over priced at $6 per drink.

-DhtAFCLtjOSUjBLMSDzyA.text: I ate here on a Friday night w my friend. We got there right at 5pm so there was no wait. It did fill up as we were eating dinner so get there early if you don't want to wait...though it didn't appear like the wait would've been very long if we had come later.  Our server was very nice & professional right off the bat. I had to wait a few minutes for my friend to arrive so he got us waters & was nice about waiting.  We ordered the house sangria to start. It was very good but not strong at all. We also ordered the crab louie appetizer and charred snap peas (a side) as a second app. Both were amazing. The crab louie was just delicious. Only regret was we were sharing because I could've easily eaten the whole thing. So good! The charred snap peas came with a harissa yogurt sauce that made the dish. It was so good. We actually save that sauce to put on our main dishes. The bread was also very good - crusty on the outside & soft inside.  We both ordered salads. I got the kale & spinach and I added salmon. My friend got the chopped and added chicken. My salmon was cooked perfectly but we both agreed that the salads we so-so. They weren't bad, just not wow like we expected after the delicious apps.  Throughout the meal we had great service. I also saw the manager throughout the evening interacting w guests & checking on meals. Overall thumbs up & I'll definitely be back...for the crab louie!

zBVkghAcKXvULZ_yTnmo-Q.text: I thoroughly enjoyed our dinner experience here last night, and it was boosted by the impeccable service we received upon entering all the way through exiting.  We arrived about 20 minutes before our reservation time, and when I said we were early, the hostesses and someone that I think was maybe the manager waved it off like it was no big deal and sat us immediately.  As we walked to our table, we were greeted by waiters and servers as we walked by.  Very friendly.  The first table we sat at was right by the back door to the patio, so my husband asked if we could move away from the door, and she said of course and promptly moved us to a booth without any hesitation.  Our waiter (I think his name was Eric) came right over and was very attentive throughout the meal.  We ordered the cheese and salume board for an app.  It was a nice portion and the truffled honey was delicious.  Word of caution, the horseradish mustard will clear your nostrils out!  So spicy!  For dinner, I had the papperdelle with oxtail ragu.  The noodles were the definition of al dente and perfect.  The ragu had a slightly sweet flavor that made me keep coming back for more as I tried to figure out what it was.  My husband got the roast chicken, which was flavorful and so moist.  He also ordered the sweet potato as a side, but the maple butter on it made it a little too sweet for me.  It's also worth noting that their wines and cocktails are nicely priced.  I had a crisp New Zealand Sauv Blanc for just $8.  Most of the cocktails were around $11.  I see in some other reviews that people mention it is noisy in there, and that is True; it was quite loud in there.  But a restaurant can really be made on its service, and everyone here was friendly, accommodating, and welcoming without being overbearing.  We had a fabulous date night!

UMr--z7oP_7AK_pd7accsg.text: Disappointing lunch.... service so-so...inattentive, water glasses left unrefilled until had to ask, waited 10 mins for dessert menu which was mia in the restaurant.   Mussels were sandy and flavor bland.   Dessert was truly sloppy ....apple pie.... for $12, I had higher expectations.... not soggy & undercooked puff pastry which seemed to have been heated in a microwave.... Wolfgang, what's up with that!!!

qTWo6ihqA_NRfe4qH0BGiA.text: Had lunch on the patio, the atmosphere was great. Our server was attentive and knowledgeable about the menu and drinks. The food was fantastic, very flavorful. Portions are average but not too little, just the right size. The main dining room is large with a fine dining aspect but still relaxed. Will definitely be back for dinner!

a32N6q6IBuerKZTArXQTGg.text: Been here on a few occasions and must recommend to always get their chef specials! I had the fish tacos, that were delicious came in 4 which was more than enough. Usually order the tuna tartare, made perfectly with these crisp chips that melt in you mouth. The happy hour cheese& charcuterie board is excellent and offers the perfect amount if you looking for a light bite. They offer a "Sunday supper" which is a prefix and that you pay(25$?) per person. However I feel your group size needs to be just the right size so the serving portions are evenly distributed. Because you want to try everything,  you're already stuffed by the 3rd course. Recommend going with that if you're in a group with hungry indecisive people

VmamhnNmamVWMkssSMFHxA.text: Our meal and service was awesome! Shawna was our server and she was very attentive and great! Will be back again!

qg59x3IOYyhfIUqYzZqaDg.text: I just want to say that the team at this restaurant does a phenomenal job. I have held two parties at this establishment, as well as a business dinner. Every time the service has been over the top and the food has been great. The staff shows every time was truly great customer service is supposed to look like. I have had many options here, but I love the salmon the best. It is always cooked to perfection with the right amount of crispiness to the outside. The yellow and green beans that come with are fantastic as well and provide a unique taste with the salmon. Their pizza is also one of a kind and I always hope to take some home to enjoy for the remainder of the week when we get to eat there. The blue cheese chips are phenomenal! I am not generally a huge blue cheese fan, but I these are down right awesome. The blueberry upside down cake is a great desert and most importantly the CHOCOLATE CHIP COOKIES! Holy Moly! They are great. I really appreciate the team and the management at this location and will continue to bring my family, business and parties here again and again!

R-nJo0R-N2hYCsxNvSt3WQ.text: I can't believe that this is the first time visiting this restaurant in Downtown Summerlin. Michelle our server was upbeat and attentive. Chuck and I were with a friend from Atlanta and we were all pleasantly surprised. Chuck ordered the fried fish and there were three delicious and generous pieces that were perfect (lightly breaded and not oily) simply delicious. My friend from Atlanta ordered a Greek Salad with shrimp. The preparation and presentation were Amazing because The chef was Generous and very creative with the ingredients. I had a new Italian salad salume and it was also excellent . We will definitely return. We loved the decor and ambiance. Perfect atmosphere for a late dinner after a show on the strip. Leave the strip and come to Summerlin Downtown for an outstanding experience.

FEK8d0E7xsmS5j_lmXYd_g.text: My friend and I came here today between the brunch time and lunch time. The service we received on this particular occasion was bad, however the food was delicious I normally order the salmon dish they have but it is not offered during brunch so I got a salad. My friend ordered the minestrone soup and that was amazing we both loved it. Although the server we had was bad, the manager came over and talked to us about our experience which we really appreciated.

hQLyeyLSaPjzseR1Ev2UNw.text: Went to dinner there Tuesday night. Even though the place was empty, the hostess seated us right next to the bus station for water service. We asked if we could be seated at quieter table, and the hostess accommodated us.   Within five minutes, sirens started going off. Flashing lights, klaxons, and a loudspeaker that told us to evacuate the building.  The waiter came to our table, and told us not to worry, they were just testing out the emergency response system. After he left, the loudspeaker again told us to a evacuate the building. It repeated this message at least 40 times.  He said they had to do this because it was a new building.  The alarm was very loud and lasted through the majority of our dining room visit..    We were given only a feeble apology.  We were never offered a complimentary drink, a complementary appetizer, or a complimentary dessert.  My recommendation to the management is to test equipment before dining service begins.

ONkVJD3RhhBZxuDw0n7GMQ.text: Thia was my first time at the Summerlin location, and I fell in love with the place.  We first requested a booth in the rear, but decided to sit in the bar area because it was brighter and more attractive to the eye. That is when we were told it was the Happy Hour area, and we were really Happy!  The menu had only 7 or 8 items for meals and 7 or 8 drink choices. but the choices were good ones.  The truffle fries were divine and we shared calamari, sweet potato fries, a pipette AND the chicken sliders.  We were pleasantly surprised and topped off the evening with a glass of Proseco and a lemon drop Martini. 5 dinner items and 3 cocktails later  (shared) we received a bill for 52.00!!  Great food at an affordable price. Sunday happy hour..great atmosphere for adults and families.. Definitely in my top 5 for light dining. Will go back soon and check out the full menu at a later date

gaGbJLmnpBlJvRqoXSwApA.text: I am ALWAYS impressed with Wolfgang Puck's places, and I have been to several. This one is NO EXCEPTION!!   From the moment we walked into the door, until the moment we left it was fantastic! The service was impeccable, the food was fresh & delicious! My partner had home made past with Rabbit Ragu - YUM!! I had a rock shrimp pizza, which was a real pizza not a flatbread pizza ( Although I love FB Pizzas too) We started with the calamari. It was a perfect lighter dinner before heading off to the movies on our date night!  What is perfect about this place is you, you could sit down with friends after a day of shopping at Downtown Summerlin and have a yummy selection of 'family style' snack foods for the table, or you could sit down for an amazing 3 course dining experience!  Here is my insider tip- During the colder months, if you make a reservation ask for inside. They did not seem to make a difference between indoor and out door dining with reservations, it is just where there is a an open table. We sat out side under a heater, which was fine for us. But was also watched another table of 4 leave because they could not accommodate their reservation inside even after they said they were cold and uncomfortable outside.  Really happy to have this new gem in the neighborhood!

nN3TcuxUQgx0_S6s5-Lhew.text: In celebration of the first day of spring we dined on the patio with a view of the beautiful foliage around the arroyo.  The patio wraps around the building and allows the choice of shade or sun plus the addition of many umbrellas and  heaters. Service was prompt and friendly. There is a nice selection wines at a reasonable price point. The starter plate chosen was grilled spanish octopus with greens, fingerling potatos and romesco sauce. The octopus was nice and tender but not over cooked. The romesco sauce worked well with the greens and potatos. The size of this dish was just right. For the main event we choose the DTS chopped salad which large enough to be an entree. The salad had a variety of vegetables and varies by market availbility. On this day  it had several lettuces, tomatoes and olives plus quinoa and croutons all incorporated in a champagne vinaigrette. As an option chicken, salmon or shrimp can be added to the salad. Desert was a wonderful pineapple upside down cake with buttermilk pineapple sherbet.  The reastaurant is another great addition to growing number of dining choices in Downtown Summerlin.

IiWkeKWC-kwd7gW-oYFOyw.text: Wolfgang Puck's Bar and Grill is my favorite restaurant in town. I was very happy to hear that they were putting one in downtown Summerlin. We ate there the day after they opened and the food was delicious. The staff was cheerful and friendly which is what I have come to expect in any Wolfgang Puck establishment. We had a wonderful evening. The Ambience wasn't great - it was kind of industrial chic. I hope they put up some photos like they have at the other Wolfgang Puck bar and Grill in town otherwise it could have been any restaurant. As it is now, the only way you would know you were dining at Wolfgang Puck's bar and Grill is because of the friendly service and the delicious food - which is okay by me.

photos.caption: Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. My husband had his favorite Wolfgang Puck meal - the Grilled Burger with perfect fries!
Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. I had the deliciously flavorful Orecchiette!

XfKqKtHbcXqGBV8NWOjvwg.text: Outstanding lunch! Our party of a dozen people was expertly served by Jason from Delaware. From the rockfish tacos to the Chinese chicken salad to the pumpkin soup (oh and yeah, the Moscow Mules), all we heard around the table were raves. Highly recommend. With so many incredible restaurant choices in LV, we don't often return again and again to a single place. But, here, we'll make the exception and definitely be back

photos.caption: Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

hZVUY_necImaoR13EF7pGA.text: Didn't get a chance to experience what appears to be a nice menu! Went at noon yesterday (Tues) and upon entering, experienced the most restaurant noise ever! We were seated, but left before ordering, as it was just too much!  PS: Google shows the location about two miles south of where it actually is: within Downtown Summerlin shopping mall. (Google shows Oval Park Drive, but when 10955 is added, it relocates it to Garden Park Drive!)

2QNq5O0s5Hguz1D3-HX9Pg.text: Took my husband here for his birthday dinner. He has a severe gluten sensitivity and the staff really catered to his needs. It can be a little awkward and I'm sure kitchens hate it, but they were patient and understanding. Our waiter talked with us for a long time about his recommendations and even talked with my husband extensively about the whiskey options. My husband is a whiskey lover so it meant a lot. The waiter even bought our drinks. Exceptional food, great cocktails, lovely restaurant. Would revisit in a heartbeat.

DQNi7EpjQJy7tbcUuL1BNA.text: Took my kids for lunch. We had burgers. Perfect! Best burgers ever with perfect seasoning. Our waiter was an immature Millennial ass who provided terrible service, otherwise I would give them 5 stars which is a rarity for me. We will try again and ask for another waiter.

aAYMRRPeB29FojdweWXOSA.text: We just moved & retired to Summerlin from Florida 2 months ago.  We checked out this place for the first time as we are fans of other Wolfgang restaurants.  The food was good..... Chicken Wings outstanding with some asian spice and we split the the Chicken Schnitzel which was plenty big enough to share and tasty. Finished off the meal with some warm chocolate chip cookies with plenty of chocolate chips and an espresso martini. The espresso martini isn't on the menu but Tiffany makes a great martini.  I love my espresso martini's and I would say this is in my top three in Vegas! But what made the evening and the 5 star rating was Ricky our server.  The service was good and prompt but his personalty & conversation will bring us back again!  Give it a try and ask for Ricky!

93D8rS2ghYs72VBCUgv1hw.text: Ooo let's do Puck!  It's happy hour!  Nope... Only at the bar... Ah well its still gonna be good... Its Puck.   There with an old friend with lots to chat about... Waiter comes and wants to be that... I want to be part of your night kinda dude... Nice and all but... We're in the middle of catching up... Ok... Drinks ordered... Starters in... Talked about avoiding carbs this week... Can't do bread.  Cue bread for the table... Awesome thanks...that sat there mocking me  Caprece salad... Holy delicious batman!  She orders pasta with chic parm... She's not avoiding carbs tonight...   I order the salmon...  Told him on on a stupid diet... Avoiding carbs... The SALMON  fast forward to getting 2 chick  parm... To which I said nope... Not me... I can't eat that... I got the salmon...   We'll he misheard me... And back to the kitchen we go...   Now to say sorry they bring out truffle TOAST!!! No carbs... So there it sits... I can't eat it... Goddamit... I'm so hungry  Gets here and now it's this bland dry salmon.   Dude..   Let's do Puck!  No dude... Lets not... Really let's not.   Money wasted   Ah well live and learn

tQObY6rOm0PEOlMsYUIaFg.text: What can i say! This is the best service, best food! Just hands down one of the best places to eat in down town Summerlin!! If you have the option see Tiffany at the bar, you will not be disappointed!

-L-wjEp7s_gRz4qYrYP8JA.text: The Holy Grail of huevos rancheros.  I've been searching all over Las Vegas for halfway decent huevos for years!    Crispy tortilla shells, layered with a well-spiced sauce, black beans, eggs and guacamole. Not a huge serving, so eat slowly. But excellent flavors.   Wife ordered egg croissant. Side salad is very fresh and the size is nice. But the dressing is overly sour for the dish. When fresh greens are slightly bitter to start with, this became too much. Wife LOVED the eggs. They were sooo fluffy. Ham is good, but a bit salty. The egg, ham and arugula in one bite is delicious, so keep your plate organized. And ask them to warm the croissant first.   Wife had ordered the spaghetti and meatballs, but sent it back. The sauce was excellent...but the meatballs were cold inside and the spaghetti was gummy. It was almost under-done on the inside.   Last time, wife had had pasta with seafood, and the pasta was gummy also. She ended up eating the seafood and leaving her pasta. Just in case you're not reading carefully:  DO NOT ORDER PASTA HERE.   Service is on point, but that's to be expected at a Puck spot.

zljdTee6xinu7fnALLNLGA.text: Friendly staff and great low key ambiance. We were seated right away and wait staff were attentive from the moment we sat down. The neutral rating is mainly due to our cold meals. My meatloaf was good. Not too dry or salty. I only wished it was warm. I thought it was only my plate but the other 2 plates also arrived cold. I was also eagered to try the monkey bread dessert which I saw on another yelper's review but come to find out they removed it from the menu.

xx94kZC9dnqGqJDcL18iFw.text: My mom and I love this spot especially for lunch! We went to dinner with my dad and husband the other night(Friday) after a mix up at another restaurant and we were greeted by a friendly host and told a 25 min wait which wasn't bad for a Friday at 7pm. A few min later the host said a table opened in the bar if we wanted that so we gladly took it. Everyone was extremely pleasant and friendly which I appreciate. Drinks did take min but food was quick. My salad was wrong but they fixed it quickly. All the food was delicious and the Golden knights puck chocolate desert was the best ending to good company and a good meal.

kqQF9UT3vMtlLFXc_USJjg.text: We went here for lunch during happy hour. It wasn't busy so service was decent. Food was pretty good. The wings and their parmesan fries were really good (thin & crispy). Don't forget to check in on yelp for a 20% off voucher!

3KsqB6APuw-Ov3_RfOmyjQ.text: This place had terrible pizza.  And wings/ calamari are just standard previously frozen appetizers. Take a look at the pizza pic. That was with "extra basil" I paid for. Ended up just getting it all to go and paid the bill before I got the food where I gave a $15 tip and they didn't even show me the food or check it themselves.   And you know once you get home it's to late to pack up your kids and go back... The waitress was nice but she and I should have checked the order.  The Place and food are about the same or less then that of a little Caesars or dominoes lol. They also turn the lights up and down while we where there for some reason.   Step up your food game Wolf Gang Puck! And with your prices and notoriety this is your end product !? Disappointed man disappointed and let down. What a waste of money. Never going to take my wife and or kid here again.   You should be embarrassed with that pizza! There are several small places here in town that know how to make a Margherita pizza with fresh basil and know what extra basil actually means. You should try them out, maybe take some notes.   And why are you going so sparingly on the cheese? Is the cheap cheese, olive oil, garlic budget that tight lol?

AF7JsHSZ7RuLcGT5OqJ61Q.text: Happy hour here has become one of my favorite happy hours in Las Vegas. It has some great food offerings as well as good deals on drinks. The patio is great for those non 100 degree days. Also, applause to the Golden Knights decor the restaurant has added!!

7PT-1HeL1e7IWzHcJokQtg.text: It's easy for a restaurant to instantly become one of my favorites when one is a perfect location that offers patio seating and a great happy hour! It's a spot where you will often catch me grabbing some small bites that are all under $10 and paired with a glass of the Wolfgang Chardonnay. Happy Hour starts at 3pm and with $2 off any glass of wine, it's really hard to say no. Although I have only sat in the bar area, service has been spot on! You really see the servers and bussers come together to ensure an impeccable experience.  Recently I was just here for a quick lunch break where my pallet was craving fish Tacos. These are amazing! Covered in a chipotle spice and paired with slaw and a dollop of an aioli sauce, you get all the flavors in one bite - without everything falling out of it (that's the worse).  Next time, I hope it's the dinner menu that I get to indulge in. Until then, see you at 3pm!

NhSAPINDULQ8YWsS3v5SsQ.text: Loud... Loud.... Loud. This restaurant is very loud. At 6:30 they ran out of the braised beef and since they were out I asked the waiter what's the next best thing. My wild boar pasta was good. Unfortunately, the hubby's $33 flat iron steak was not done properly. Paid $178 for a dinner without dessert. Hmm... Not so good. Not planning to come back.

G5yxqtx47ywVcfxcjcJMYQ.text: I met a friend here for lunch and we were both really pleased with our food and our server was great about checking on us. I've had this place on my bookmark list since it opened and am glad I finally checked this place out, but regret not coming sooner because the pizza I had was perfection. I came here with an open mind and had no expectations other than the what I'd usually expect from a WP restaurant which is exactly what I experienced. I personally find the menu to be spot on given it's a bar and grill and this place fits perfectly in Downtown Summerlin.   We started out with cocktails, I had the Classic Margarita, and we finished our meal with coffee and both tasted great.  Truffle Potato Chips ($9) - House-made potato chips infused with truffle oil and covered with Maytag blue cheese sauce and chunks of cheese. Get this! The chips taste great alone, but the cheese sauce just takes the chips to another level. My friend and I had no shame when it came to scraping up every last bit of cheese sauce we could from the bottom of the bowl. Very good!  Margherita Pizza ($15) - The sauce tasted so fresh and the crust had the perfect crispness. I loved every bite of this pizza and will absolutely order it again. Not surprising at a WP restaurant that the pizza was amazing. The price was fair given the quality ingredients and they do have gluten free crusts on small pizzas if that's your thing.  The HH menu is worth checking out and they also offer patio dining. I'll be back.

xpSdBEoqH9zx4pQ1-xD6vA.text: Food was good but over priced.   Came in after shopping in the area, was seated immediately but our server took quite a while to greet us and get us water. Had to wait awhile for re-fills too. But they were under-staffed, she wasn't being lazy or un-attentive, she just had too many tables. Long story short, food was really good but too expensive for the portion and the average ingredients.   My friend got the seafood pasta which came with very little pasta and a few shrimp and small scallops and clams. Sauce was average and nothing amazing. My pasta was really good, but again, too expensive for what it was. The potato chips with blue cheese and truffle oil was really good. $9 for a bowl of chicken tortilla "broth" was not worth it - Yard House has way tastier chicken tortilla soup.   Thank goodness for the 20% off when you check-in on Yelp...still not worth it even after the discount.

l8VjFlTd1Dr6COohmpu_-w.text: We have been going to Spago restaurants for 30 years. Always an amazing meal. This is the second time that this restaurant was terrible. The service was nonexistent. Cold food when it finally came. This is certainly not up to Spago standards. They need to do some serious training of the waitstaff.

iXNMDUBdCeXq-lGMjBiW3Q.text: The Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill doesn't officially open until November 5, 2014, according to the wolfgangpuck.com website, but I was lucky to stumble in on their soft opening a day early. All the head honchos were in attendance, from Wolfgang's "right-hand" man to the executive chef of Wolfgang Puck (as told to us by our waiter). Customer service, to say the least, was on point. All hands were on deck, and no one was left wanting. Complimentary bread infused with herbs and olive oil was served in an adorable wooden bowl. The bread was incredibly soft, thick, and flaky too! We told our waiter to keep those bad boys coming. :) For starters, I shared the artisanal cheese and salami plate ($16) with my better half. I was surprised that the plate came with only 2 types of cheeses, and was hoping for something grandiose due to the hefty price tag. When the plate arrived on top of a weathered cheese board, the pickings were slim. Call me plain, but the cheeses, sauces, and adornments on the plate were too "fancy" (i.e., overwhelmingly powerful and distinct) for my palate. My husband ordered the mesquite burger for $13, which is damn cheap for the quality. He was ultimately only able to finish half the burger, so it was decent sized. I was told the burger was juicy, too. The fries were plentiful, fresh, and warm. I had to restrain myself from eating all his fries! There was only one snafu: he had to send the burger back because he ordered it medium well but was presented with a medium rare burger. The kitchen was quick to fix the problem and the manager himself came to our table not only to apologize, but insisted despite our protests that our dinner would be taken care of. I ordered the rigatoni dish minus the turkey bolognese sauce ($15), opting for a tomato based sauce instead. The sauce was perfectly creamy and the dish was overall extremely filling. The standard of customer service displayed here at Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill was unreal. The waiter literally helped seat me by scooting me in my chair and dropped a napkin across my lap. Our waiter was extremely attentive, friendly, and knowledgeable on every menu item we asked about. My water glass was never empty and the employees frequently checked up on us to make sure everything was okay. I think my silverware was changed at least three times. Plates were cleared off almost immediately - it was like magic! When the waiter cleared our cheese plate from the table, he picked up a miniscule crumb of cheese off my husband's place mat (seriously). I was over the moon about the whole customer service experience. To sum everything up: Ambiance: 4 Food: 4 Customer Service: 5+ I didn't save room for dessert, but the Monkey Bread was highly recommended by the staff. I will definitely come back to this new Wolfgang Puck location in Downtown Summerlin. I'm salivating over what I imagine the Monkey Bread will taste like, and would love to try the pizza next time! Customer service quality alone makes a return visit necessary, and is why I rated Wolfgang 5 stars. I hope that their standards for customer service will remain unchanged after some time passes. Keep up the good work!

5tL6CjpWx7XRBzi0SNNEMA.text: We stopped by to try their Oktoberfest promotion for dinner and it was an overall tasty experience.  We pretty much ordered everything off of the Oktoberfest menu and were not disappointed!  We started with the freshly baked German pretzel and the meat and cheese board, the latter of which had a nice selection of artisan cheese and the meats were great.  For our mains, I had the schnitzel and my wife had the spicy goulash, both of which were really delicious.  The schnitzel was pounded out flat and was a ginormous portion.  We finished the meal by sharing the German chocolate cake.  Crazy delicious!!!!  It was only our second time at this location and it was well worth it. iAzCW-USepq-5r_tAhLh1Q.text: A staple + favorite for us in Summerlin. Ian (server) is EXCELLENT and the food is always fabulous. The rigatoni noodle is FRESH MADE + VEGAN! The salmon is wild caught, which is a difficult find nowadays in restaurants.

LKvuRMJNoR1v0zLe8cjNYw.text: Wolfgang Puck always been fan of in general. Lately seems like every "star" celebrity chef opens up different concept restaurants under the same name. It was my first time at his Bar & Grill concept restaurant. I have been to Spago and couple other ones. I have never had bad experience but times that just been ok. Bar & Grill fell under the ok. The potato chips with the blue cheese sauce or creamy goodies on top. Perfect combination! The only thing that would have stopped me from raving about it. The worst thing could do with potato chips thin sliced deep fried to order is getting lump of chips. Not individual nicely fried chips that take time drop them in the fryer or move it around rather then dump bunch in walk away. The combination solid. The Creamy Mac 'n' Cheese truffle crumbs. If there was one five star that stole the show was this dish. It not often rave about mac and cheese. I love love the fact that not super thick cheesy but nice creamy. You can taste the hint of truffle in the cheese and still has rich body from the cheese. The pasta not elbow variety but more Orecchiette style. Nice cause in each bite get full effect of sauce, pasta, and the truffle crumbs on top. Winnah. If I could order full size then appetizer I would be all over that pasta.   I ordered the Orecchiette Pasta, Italian Sausage, Cherry Tomato, Broccolini, fine herbs for my entree.  It was ok. The sauce was more light butter/cream sauce. It liked. It had ample and equal amounts of everything else. I also tried the calamari. Nothing special just ordinary calamari. It was Ohana family dinner so tried piece of my brother entree the grilled flat iron steak. Nothing stood out about that dish for me. Overall really ok no WoW factor or something that would make me want come running back again.   The service was awesome. The hostess that seated us, our waitress, and later management came checked make sure everything was good. All five star service without doubt for me. Friendly, attentive, and made the dining experience great one!   The interior decor is interesting. It open kitchen, You have almost chefs bar counter area right in front that can sit down eat. It good spot if dining alone. They have bunch of televisions in the restaurant keep you update on sports. The bar area once walk in on your left like the set up. It one long counter but like the design. Again got couple wide screens with games on watch over some drinks and conversations with friends.   It in great location in Downtown Summerlin.
