OU_hW3KtBzJMkLE-JrRsOA.text: I was a little disappointed about the food it wasn't as good as i would hope. I'm not sure if it just don't have the flavor i was hoping for. The service was great and the place is nice but food wasn't to my expectations of wolfgangs puck establishment.

zeZsefBS0p5M7T_2E0S02A.text: Wow this place has gone downhill...been here a couple of dozen times over the last few years.  Haven't had a good meal here in over a year.  Just bad execution and poor quality control...little things like overdressed salad or poorly seasoned dishes...service is solid but I can't justify coming here for such mediocre food at that price point.  Rather go to CPK next door where the managers pay a visit to the table every time and the quality is more consistent at a slightly lower price point.

seNCV5y8ojBpyK7ZGJ-C8Q.text: It's like I wasn't there. 5/18/18 at or about 1230. Went in, sat at the bar with only two other customers there. Manager, WFA with long black hair and a middle aged WMA bartender were doing something on the POS. After a few the manager left, the bartender spoke to the two at the bar and then left himself.   Not once did the manager or bartender acknowledge that I was sitting there for 10 minutes. No "I'll be with you shortly" or anything. So I got up and left. I even asked the hostess if she saw me on the way out.   I think the Puck Group needs to put those two through customer service training again. It takes but a moment to make contact with a guest.

zzr2Xyhk5vcsWChDmSC1zQ.text: I went here for the first time with my wife, 3 kids under 11 and my dad. We each had food that we absolutely loved. My dad is a spaghetti and meatballs snob and he absolutely loved his. My wife's fish and chips were some of the best I've had and my bbq chicken pizza was also great. My kids ordered pizza, chicken fingers and a cheeseburger from the kids menu and they were each thrilled with their food. They did bring out the wrong order for my wife at first, but rectified the problem quickly. All in all it was a great place to take the family and we'll definitely go back.

Xx_7D0xMcwOFYxr9r3B6Rw.text: The food is amazing but the service is inconsistent.  If we go and Ricky is working - it will be a perfect dinner.  He takes care of us every time.  This location is one of our favorite restaurants in town.  They have menu changes sometimes which is surprisingly delicious.

hruEpJEWrgjC2twtXBYFYQ.text: Came here fore a work lunch on a Tuesday.  It was pretty empty when we came around 11:30, but the place is very large, so I suppose they don't fill up to capacity during the weekday.    We started off with truffled potato chips with maytag blue cheese fondue for $7.  Pretty yummy and very oily.  Good thing all 6 of us at the table shared it as our appetizer.    For my lunch, I went for the Italian fennel sausage pizza for $15.  It was very large, but I ate the whole thing because I am a piggy.  The pizza was tasty, but also quite salty and oily.  I wanted to try a pizza because that is what they are known for, but I think if I ever went back to Wolfgang Puck's, I would try to get something healthier next time.    The restaurant itself is quite nice and upscale, and the service is very good.  It's located in the middle of a very large and nice outdoor mall.  Too bad I didn't get to check out the rest of the mall, but the little bit that we saw while walking through looked quite nice.

rjqr4hXioOxR77l578YDgA.text: Our waitstaff was amazing. Good people...attentive and friendly. The place itself is pretty cute and comfy. We came early and, except for eating at Wolfgang Puck's at some airports, this was my first time here. Wolfgang Puck is an icon. He is known for his food and creating innovative dishes. Since that is the case, and that was my expectation, why is the menu so boring? The same-old appetizers that everyone else has plus the same-old pizzas, burgers, salads, and pasta. We had -  Wife had wine...I had beer...and... Appetizer - Buffalo Blue Tator Tots (needed more bacon...maybe some jalapenos) Black Bean Soup (excellent!...could have been a little spicier) Wife had the Chopped Chicken Ceasar (same as everyone else's) I had the Salume/Jalapeno Pizza (This was tasty...but not mind-numbingly good)  If your name is Wolfgang Puck...I would have thought that the food would be as impressive as the reputation. (and don't make me ask for salt and pepper shakers...put them on the damn table)  Not a bad place...just a place.

4mU5D_q0MtscBHvhUWS8FA.text: This was to be the last hurrah meal during the weekend in Vegas.  Since I had grown tired of dealing with Strip traffic, I nudged my travel companions to checkout Summerlin since I knew it'd be quieter yet as (if not more) upscale than the Strip.  I was not disappointed!   I had been to a Wolfgang Puck concept in Tulsa, OK a few years back and greatly enjoyed the dish I had (bacon-wrapped meatloaf and mash potatoes), and I found the food just as scrumptious at this bar & grill.  We were greeted by friendly waitstaff as we entered and asked our preference on seating.  We chose the patio as the restaurant wasn't packed.  My dining companions ordered bottomless mimosas (affordably priced!) and enjoyed swift refills.  We ordered brunch food and all had positive reviews on the taste and quality.  I in particular had french toast which had the consistency of funnel cake yet blew my mind!  It was a bizarre combination of high and low but it totally worked.  The toast was served with traditional maple syrup and a berry sauce.  The funnel cake style french toast was so savory that I only used the raspberry sauce and abstained from the syrup.  I also ordered a side of bacon which was acceptable as expected.    While the food should always be the star of a Wolfgang Puck grill, I found the atmosphere and service to be the standouts.  The patio was designed with foot traffic in mind and we were seated at an adequate distance from our neighbors so as to not invade their space. Seating was comfortable and our metal table was sturdy.  The interior of the restaurant was spacious with a modern flair (lots of steel and smooth industrial floors).  Lastly, we didn't have to flag down our server ever and checkout was a breeze.  Recommended with gusto!

4iNxy-scf8pwocqKX8fTww.text: This used to be my spot but now it's no longer the place for me. The happy hour used to be until they close but now it's only from 3-7pm and they've removed some items off of their happy hour menu....total bummer! And the service used to be spectacular but my service yesterday was mediocre. Our server checked on us twice and half assed it the entire time mind you the bar was NOT busy! She gave the other couple at the bar her attention. The manager got wind of our experience and gave us a 20%off card for next time if there is a next time. I wasn't looking for a discount but I was looking for another glass of wine and dessert but I ended up leaving because I was really upset about the lack of service. I give two stars because the food was good.

9DCgd3unbiE87sI6Kbbklw.text: My family and another family (6 people total) came in after the DT Summerlin Christmas parade last night. To say they were slammed would be an understatement. The hostesses were very friendly and even tho there was a wait (for obvious reasons, all of DT Summerlin was a zoo), we were seated fast. The manager Jason and his team were amazing! It's rare to find a restaurant this busy with fast, prompt, attentive service with the food made and tasting as it should. Never were we left needing a drink refill, or any need not taken care of. And they did it with a smile! Even though it was a crazy busy environment, everyone seemed to be helping each other and enjoying the hustle and bustle. This is what you want for a restaurant. Nice people, efficiency, well seasoned food, fast service, fun environment. So glad we chose to come here instead of the other restaurants in DT Summerlin. Jason and his crew have it down! Thank you for a fun night, even our 7 and 2 year olds enjoyed themselves. Adults and kids alike had an awesome experience. Thank you for a great holiday evening!

iuthE8tJx5DuBxNzFLmWFg.text: The food here is certainly tasty. And the service is AMAZING. For our appetizers we got the buffalo cauliflower and the tater tots, which was kind of a bad idea on our part since they both have buffalo sauce in them. Those tater tots were perfect. If you think you have had good tater tots, you haven't tried these. You have to try them. I got the wienerschnitzel, which I learned from the server is what Wolfgang orders whenever he comes. The food was perfect. Then dessert came. I don't know how so many things went wrong and everything came out right. I think it is the service. If it weren't for our waiter, everything would be ruined. We ordered the bread pudding and the skillet cake. Our server came over later and told us they were out of bread pudding. We got the creme brulee instead. We waited for a strangely long time, and then the dessert sort of came out. The creme brulee came out fine, but instead of the skillet cake, we got a brownie looking thing with chocolate sauce. We asked him about how this isn't a skillet cake, and he told us they didn't make that anymore, and they use a brownie instead of the cake. But, he informed us, they forgot to put ice cream on top of the brownie. So, he took it back to get ice cream. We ate the creme brulee, and it was delicious, actually my favorite dessert. A little while later, a plate of tiramisu came out. The server told us it was on the house. Of course we were happy, who doesn't want free dessert? Then the brownie WITH ICE CREAM came out. It was good, but it was really nothing that special. But GEEZ the server was nice. By the end, we got free tiramisu, paid only three dollars for the brownie, and got twenty percent off the meal for their mistakes. I mean, what's wrong with that. The excellent service here really saved this experience.

Wl2jtaE_c_nxezsUDt28_g.text: We decided to take our pup to the mall because he loves it there and couldn't decide where to eat. As we were getting closer to Wolfgang's all I could hear were barking dogs on the patio and I new this was my spot. Everyone sitting on the patio on Sunday had a dog or 2 with them. I love that they are so welcoming of dogs here. They even bring out big bowls of ice water.  Bri was our waitress and she is a dog lover. Bri brought us the menu and had those bottomless mimosas at our table in seconds. This was our first time here and Bri gave us some great recommendations. We ordered all of them. And I love the fact that Bri was honest and told us the large pizza was too big for just the 2 of us since we were ordering other things.   We ordered the Huevos Rancheros w/ Black Beans. I order this at every restaurant because it is always different. This was excellent-- I have never had it where the tortillas were crunchy like a tostada. I would go back just for this meal.  Next up was the Small Smoked Salmon Pizza w/ dill cream, red onions and a little dollop of caviar. I did like this pizza but it had way too much salmon on it for me. The BF loved it and ate most of it. If I ordered it again I would probably order it with light salmon. I know that sounds weird but just my preference.  The grand finale was the Truffle Potato Chips w/ Blue Cheese. Yes you read that right. TRUFFLE POTATO CHIPS. Woo Hoo- they were so good. Chips tasted homemade and the the blue cheese sauce was very light and just everywhere. They were perfect.   You can never go wrong with bottomless mimosas so we made sure to take full advantage of the bottomless. This restaurant is really beautiful and I love the patio seating. It was so nice and relaxing. I love that it's in the back and you don't get the mall crowd walking by staring at you.  Go check this place out, sit outside and ask for Bri. We will be back for sure.

ozb8LXrSr2ig1-zJP7sHPg.text: I really do not think I've ever had a bad meal here, and I've been here maaany times! The staff is really amazing and the environment is a tad dark but well done. The patio is especially lovely this time of year! But let's talk about the food... from their cauliflower chicken dish (pictured below) to their pasta, pizza, salmon, salad, you name it- it's ALL delicious!! They are also super accommodating and understanding. For instance, one time I asked for an iced coffee and the nice waitress said they didn't have that, but that she would check if they could figure something out and MAGIC she made it happen. So thoughtful! I could never imagine having a bad experience here and always look forward to coming back!

uCeo82WY8Rpe7lzezueXVQ.text: Our waiter, Ricky, was genuinely friendly and very attentive. It was my first time and Mom's first time at this hot spot, both of us coming out of the meal with great memories. Our visit was right before closing time but Ricky never left us feeling neglected or unwanted.  Pepperoni pizza and soft, fresh baked chocolate chip cookies were all flavorful masterpieces, but the service will definitely have us returning.

Yte8dojNuWhl221jvBu6bA.text: This restaurant was cute and not super busy when we came for brunch. I liked how they offered a 20% discount when you check in on yelp.   My husband loves his bottomless mimosas so we came here for that purpose. The bartender was actually our server and whenever she saw the glass almost empty she  was always there to fill out up. I had the berry smoothie which was good but the after taste was sour.   We ordered the avocado toast to start. When it came out it was over piece of toast with avocado, tomato, radish and a handful of salad. We had different expectations because everywhere else we get avocado toast it comes in either two or three smaller breads.   For our entree we shared a barbeque chicken pizza. The pizza was okay. Not the best I've had but I managed to eat a couple of slices since I didn't really eat much of the avocado toast.   Overall, if you're coming here for bottomless mimosas I recommend sitting in the bar area. The bartender was very attentive and super friendly. The food was okay, but if you do dine in don't forget to check in!

677oG_LKPM4BlBCvQC3qjA.text: Delicious meal, exquisitely prepared with star service!  Being in the mood for something special, but one where I didn't have to get changed into something fancy, I chose to dine at Wolfgang Puck tonight. I have been going for a few nights for dinners and lunches, but I have never tried their tasting menu.  Dining on my own, I thought it would be perfect since I wanted to try new dishes, but didn't have to deal with a massive amount of food on my own. Generally, the tasting menu is for 2 or more people, but the staff   took pity on a solo diner.   It's not because they let me try it that I'm gushing, but it's been a while in Summerlin where I feel I've had a perfect meal. I have my favorites in town, but, let's just say that it's been a while since I've so thoroughly enjoyed my meal like tonight.  To start, the staff was friendly, inviting, and accommodating. The service was well paced, and not intrusive. I portion sizes for the tasting meal was perfect for me, and you get five dishes, so it filled me up. Some may think it small, but I think it's exactly the amount of food - actually they give you more than what one should eat healthily for a dinner.   The tasting menu consisted of 5 dishes. 1) an appetizer of salmon tartar - two oval mounds with creme fraiche and two large pieces of potato chip. The salmon was seasoned with a bit of crunch from cucumbers. It was mild in flavor, but the potato chips made a difference. It was clean tasting and and just enough to get my appetite going. Really good!  2) I've been eating a lot of their WP Chopped, and never tasted the Apple Endive. It's my new favorite. It has endive, macaron almonds, fennel, apples, and I forget what else. It comes with dots of balsamic, and it's crunchy, vinegary, sweet, and savory. Loved it!   3) Pappardelle with boar was fabulous. I'm going to run out of superlatives to describe my meal. The pasta was thinner than most pappardelle, so that you can almost see your fork on the other side. The sauce was just sticky enough to coat each of the strands, and it was perfectly seasoned. I usually ask for chili flakes on my pasta, but I didn't even ask for it this time, because it was really flavorful. After this dish, I was getting full, and wondered how many dishes were in a tasting menu here. I finished everything. I'm on a low carb diet as well, but I ate the whole thing. It was just enough for me not to feel guilty. If I weren't on low carb, I'd definitely order this many times.  4) The market fish. I forgot what fish it was, but it was flaky and cooked well. I loved the foam. I think the server said it was some mushroom flavor... I don't know. But it was slightly salty, and ethereal - yeah, it's foam so it doesn't linger. The skin on the fish was crispy. I peeled it off and ate the whole thing first. So yummy. then, I squeezed the charred lemon on the rest of the fish and spinach. This dish is flavorful, but also super health. I'm on weight watchers, and on the program, I can probably eat this all night long. Excellent!  5) Finally, the dessert was cheesecake. Not just any cheesecake, but one that is creamy, moist, with texture that was substantial but also melted with a great mouthfeel. It came with fresh berries, whipped cream, and coulis. It was just the right amount of sweetness. I had to really work on my will power not to finish it, but it hit the spot.   This was the perfect meal I was craving all day, and they delivered. THANKS for a great meal. AND, for $50, I think I'd go back again. Maybe it's not an every day meal for every one, but it sure felt like a value to me for all that I tried. The portions for me were great, and I'm not overstuffed and feeling uncomfortable after the meal. It was healthy, and super tasty.   Wolfgang Puck has really kicked it up a few notches.

toR2Io_eI23-WoGKoC9P1A.text: The mussels were small but tender. Too many ones with sand for my liking. The mussels are under seasoned. It came with a piece of bread. Not wanting to chip any teeth I left a little over half of my mussels left. It wasn't any good anyway. The restaurant was empty for Saturday at 8:30pm. Plenty of staff but no one bothered to fill my cup once with water. My first and last time at this place. I wouldn't recommend coming here. Wolfgang Pucks name gets people through the door but service and food are what keeps customers coming back. You get better mussels at Red Rock Station next door.....that's far from being a complimentary statement.

PQ1MBN6KYJE--xlJXCBT2w.text: One of our favorite places. Never disappoints we had the taster tots to start and they were crispy and brown and covered in blue cheese. My son had the flank steak and it was cooked Medium rare as requested and was seasoned perfectly. It's amazing how many places can't cook a steak right but they do here. My wife had the  Pizza. It was good, she had the cheese this time, after having the pepperoni last time. I had the salmon and it was so good. Crispy on the outside and soft in the middle. Love a fish with a crust. Came with arugula salad and a bean ragout. The bean ragout was just ok, some were pretty hard. I ordered a side of Mexican street corn and it was so delicious it more than made up for the bean ragout. Seasoned with a chili lime and cheese it was so good I ate every kernel. We'll be back again soon I'm sure!

nflW4B2QvjhSgZ9LkUeq1A.text: This weekend we went to Wolfgang Summerlin on Saturday for lunch and back on a Sunday for brunch.  Sorry no pics of lunch on Saturday (we were starving and I forgot to take pics).  However, lunch Saturday is what brought us back for brunch on Sunday and I preferred the Saturday lunch over the Sunday brunch.  Saturday we ordered the Orecchiette (sausage and broccolini) and the chicken salad sandwich. Both were awesome and would definitely go back for and reorder.  The chicken salad sandwich came on a bread with fruit and nuts in it and was awesome!  Sprouts, golden raisins, grapes, almonds so great!  Nice bathrooms, food size bar, and on Saturday they sell fresh bread to take home.   Sunday we had brunch pics to follow. We had the turkey burger, the stuffed berry French toast, and the charcuterie plate.  There was a lamb chopper cheese on the charcuterie plate that was really tasty and the prosciutto was good quality.  The turkey burger was a solid burger with pepper jack and fresh veg toppings (yum).  The French toast was ok.  It's a bit heavy but not to sweet.  The fresh fruit on top was a great addition (unlikely to reorder the french toast). But would maybe opt for the waffle instead.    Overall price point for quality was great.  And lunch there will happen again soon.

0jJ1bHQ4sVsKiIaKEZMGqQ.text: We went for a happy hour and everything was delicious!!! We started with the chicken nachos and sangria. (Can't beat $5 sangria) for dinner I had the baked rigatoni. Full of flavor super delicious. Carla the bartender was so sweet and efficient. We will be back!

TI1msPGWTSK0IFPxDig1BQ.text: My fiance and I went about a month after this place opened with high hopes since we love the location at MGM. We were quickly disappointed. Here's a list of the pros and cons in short because I don't even want to write a full review with detail because it might be just as painful as our experience there was.   Pros -Waitress was nice -Decent Salads   Cons -Terrible seating (we were literally seated at the entrance and inches away from the table next to us)  -Steak was awful -Sea Bass was unimpressive  -I wouldn't of even paid half of the amount of money we spent for the quality of food we received.   Just a let down all together.

1WezVRaNfWJixZUSuPj7jg.text: First time here..definitely will come back. The service, food and overall vibe of the space is everythibg you woukd expect from a WP property. I had the Chinese Chicken Salad and a Baked Sweet Potato..random choices on.my part..but delicious and filling. Cannot wait to try the rest of the menu.

photos.caption: Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chinese Chicken Salad

B9qld7SASMEHF2t93LCfNQ.text: This was our first time here and overall it was a very good experience. Food was delicious and service was prompt. Our meal was delivered quick. It seemed like it took only 10 minutes, might be because the place wasn't super busy. Anyway, great place and I would definitely eat here again.

Y5yHjLM_0EubSEDmQamA6A.text: This restaurant is good. The bleu cheese potato chips are super good and about the only thing I go there for. The service can be spotty when you're there depending on the day, especially in the bar area. It's a nice place to drop in for something small.

V_L_YD-sHqP7LmRCQ1Uieg.text: We celebrated a birthday last night and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. The variety of offerings worked well with our group of 6.  The calamari was perfect and the grilled lemon half was a plus.  I am not normally a meatloaf lover, but figured "what the heck...it's Puck's".  this was by far the best meatloaf I have ever had.  The flavor was smoky as if it had been cooked in the wood fire pizza oven. It was topped with delicate and crispy onion rings.  We complimented our meal with a 1/2 price bottle of really good wine.  The service was exceptional as well.  Thank you for making our evening so special.

fS5jCPqjyEb84G3jjxbRBg.text: I was pleasantly surprised at how good this place was. A lot of restaurants trade on the name of a famous chef but don't deliver the quality. Cut, however, is one of my favorite places in Vegas so I was willing to give this place a chance, and it delivered.   First, i would suggest a reservation as its usually pretty busy. In fact before I got in I tried to make a res on 2-3 other nights and they were fully booked. I think that has died down a bit now that its been open for a while but its still pretty busy.  Second, I thought the service was great. One small example- as a manly man I am not a big fan of "splitting" entrees, there are few things more emasculating than admitting to a server you can't finish the arugula Caesar salad on your own. When I went here I got talked into splitting Steak Frites with someone and as embarrassing as that could have been they brought it already divided on 2 separate plates and gave each of us a monster portion of fries that allowed me to leave with some small semblance of my dignity in tact. Its the little things. The steak was good, but the fries were amazing- I know I know how good could regular fries be? Turns out pretty good.   Third, Location- its past the movie theater and close to CREAM. There isn't a lot of parking immediately around it though. Having never been to downtown Summerlin I asked a few people for directions and they were all pretty inaccurate.   If I HAD to come up with a criticism I would say that the App section is a little lackluster.

owKVBCa0TbdwnV-gTyD91A.text: Great food! The Mahi Mahi tacos are melt in your mouth delicious! ! The turkey burger, the Margherita pizza and the Mac-n-cheese are all great!! The cocktails, the service and the dining are worth it!!

photos.caption: Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Turkey burger and the creamiest mac-n-cheese on earth!
Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Mahi Mahi tacos are melt in your mouth delicious!!

NXRFsTvDTYeA7B6B6XBFPQ.text: We expected more considering this has the name of "WOLFGANG" The Margherita pizza we had the dough is so tough on that you can barely eat the crust.  We also had a pasta dish.   We place the order and no kidding this order was out within six or seven minutes.... The pasta was not very hot, I'm not sure if the stuff is premade and they throw it together or what?   Definitely not impressed.

I2KjXJ3tPL9cCEMSdfxZlA.text: The food was okay though it isn't worth the price. It's over charging. The service was horrible. My server didn't introduce us special dish or promotion and didn't give us any information about he menu. However, he was very professional with the table which came after us and sat next to us. He let them know what benefits that they could have, what was the special dish. He came back and check this table often but ignored my table and my table was right next to. It's rude and unprofessional. It was horrible server. I tipped him 10% and though he didn't deserve 10% tips at all.

u8wVl2sYTfgPuzEWpyjycA.text: Good quality food. Excellent service. Good deals on happy hour. Half price wine M-Th. What's not to like?

ATjmm4OWjtSFxGSr1rnQ7g.text: We eat here several times a week, mostly at lunch during weekdays and for brunch on Sunday.  The hamburgers, french fries and Caesar salad are among the very best in Las Vegas.  Pizza, Chinese chicken salad and many other menu items are absolutely great.  Love the Huevos Rancheros at Sunday brunch are fabulous--though not filiing.  Service is first rate.

zGzTpBkt4dkH3zHhb8DZzA.text: I love everything about this restaurant!!!! The Fritto Misto is absolutely fabulous and one of my favorite appetizers of ALL TIME!!!! You can also get bottomless mimosas on Sunday brunch as well as a killer brunch menu!!!!!! Try the rancheros!!! If you go in for dinner be sure and ask for Randy because he will treat you like family! On point management team as well with Sara and Brad!!!!! Love you guys and will be back FOR SURE!!!!!!!!!!

QqRi2Ar1h3IId4Ymjw_r0A.text: I live and work in Downtown Summerlin and was looking forward to trying them for the first time this afternoon. I went during lunch and as expected a busy time. There were at least 3 open four top tables I could see. I went by myself and when telling the hostess "just one", she went over and consulted with someone, possibly a Sever. She came back and offered me a table literally sitting with a party of 10 men, it was a two top that was pushed up against their table and you would have been essentially been joining their party. I asked her if that was all she had, and she hesitated, as if she didn't want to give me a four top table and I was taking up space. I am not insecure, however being a female and being offered a seat at a table with a party of 10 men is not of interest to me, and I am sure would have been awkward for the group already sitting there. I planned on ordering nice wine, a nice appetizer and meal, and most likely would have spent more money than 2 people taking up a 4 top. I let the hostess know that since I was taking up space I would go somewhere else. Very disappointing experience and service for a Wolfgang Puck restaurant!

_1qw3FSrETUNUhDe_Nv4TQ.text: The service was excellent although the woman I was with knows the waiter so I am sure that had something to do with it.   Oysters- tiny and smelly - $19 Tuna tartare - grey and strong fish smell ( seemed old to me) $19 Pre-made beet salad (not bad - worth $6) $14 Panna water $6.50 a bottle  Rigatoni (she liked it) I thought it was ok $16 Spaghetti and meatballs- pasta was undercooked and sauce was like spaghetti-O's , meatballs were bland.  Broccolini- hard and minced like we got leftovers $6  Go to Nora's and save $80 and get real food.  I could see why the restaurant was nearly empty on a Friday evening at 8PM!   As a bonus my date was served wine in a dirty glass.... The only thing I can't figure out is why I gave it the second star??

1A4fgwnnUlx6eUK7rvpokQ.text: UPDATE Revisited the grill after picking up my new iPhone from the Apple store. Not much has changed.   I'm beginning to think this is not truly a restaurant owned by the world famous chef Wolfgang Puck but rather some kind of low end franchise deal.  Simply stated, this place just does not live up to the high standards of quality service and food for which chef Puck is famous.

IZlw32nPnVuuieTAqRf1Bg.text: Carla is amazing! Go see her at the bar and ask for her recommendations! She's skilled, friendly and fast! She's truly an asset to the company and is a reason so many regulars come back time and time again!!  Get the barrel aged Manhattan for your drinks.   And come for happy hour every day after 3p!!!  For dinner I recommend the Caesar salad: but order it with chicken and have them chop it! Perfect portion!!!  and nachos... Any good place I frequent had a nacho on the menu but the nice happy hour nachos here are AMAZING!! I wish they had a full portion size!!   I've had lunch, dinner, a corporate dinner and plenty of happy hour visits to this place and it's one of my favorites!!   Short answer: This place is great!

cyCySGjGYJUse-WRlciEwg.text: This is probably not my favorite steakhouse in town. I understand that going to downtown summerlin, moreover to a Wolfgang Puck restaurant that I will be paying for a premium but premium service and food should be expected as well. Paying $24 for a salad and $10 more to add a couple strips of chicken so thin that my girlfriend begins to become impressed with me is blasphemous. Once again moreover, asking politely to our server who will not be named (Isaac) responds with "Yup" after everything isn't just rude but really annoying. If my previously mentioned girlfriend wanted to here yup from someone after every question; we would've stayed at home and she could've asked me to do work around the house. Next time I go to Wolfgang Puck's restaurant I expect to get fisted from him personally instead of the service and prices for those services.  Restaurant is pretty clean though.

GB4KlrDZEPZaq5TYh1Eigw.text: The food tasted pretty good here but every time I've gone the service has been absolutely terrible. The staff get orders confused all the time and are extremely slow as well

M0HB3HrfD1P1sQjiY-iJKg.text: Great service thanks to Victor! Superb and tasty food!(thumbs up to the chef and staff in the kitchen) But most of all this restaurant is kid friendly! We're almost at the end of our meal when Agustin went to our table and asked us if my daughter is interested in making her own pizza since the place is not very busy, of course my daughter said yes and she loved every second of it! It was an awesome and fun experience! Now she wants to be a pizza maker when she grows up! Kudos to Agustin, Victor, Chef and all the staff of this amazing restaurant!

photos.caption: Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari! Crispy and tender at the same time!
Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fish tacos and baked ziti
Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Fun experience making her own pizza

c8BGNOmlg-cu47kyNfeCiA.text: I have been to many of his restaurants and usually I am impressed. This was my first time at the DT Summerlin location. Met some friends for the 8PM happy hour. I like 8PM happy hours.  Cox was holding a very loud gathering at the bar. Felt more like a sports bar then anything that would have Wolfgang's name on it.  The happy hour pricing on the apps was good however the plate of calamari was tiny. Compare this to the size of the calamari app at Sienna. Night and day.

RyOEECPNEPObsSby6aK0wQ.text: I decided to try something new today and ended up here! Overall the experience was good! The menu was small and simple. The restaurant looked beautiful inside and was very inviting I loved that you could see the kitchen. I loved he wood door. I ordered the Chinese Chicken Salad and loved every single bite. Chicken was so tender and juicy and the cashews and wontons were perfect. Also we ordered the fish and chips. Fries were seasoned to perfection and fish was crispy and good! The only thing that would have made this better was the service! It wasn't anything to complain about I just would have expected more with such great food for high prices.

a-v7FFmIkfg1Adt0__Hj_g.text: The food here is really good as you would expect.  The Chinese Chicken Salad is quite good.    The truffle butter potato chips are a good appetizer to share.   We enjoy sitting on the patio and people watching.   Service is good, but not fast.   This is a leisurely place to dine

iFjkZibRp9HgR7QGL_UrBw.text: We have been coming here since it opened, and it used to be really really great. Our last two experiences here, however, have left alot to be desired. The service was painfully slow, a meal that should have taken no more than an hour or so dragged on for over two hours. Most of that time was spent t waiting, drinks were never refilled, in fact my boyfriend waited for so long for a refill that all of the ice in his glass had melted and he drank that until empty. We ordered dessert and the salted caramel ice cream was so salty that all 3 people at the table agreed it was completely inedible.  I could go in to more detail on how atrocious our service was, but truly I feel that I don't want to waste more of my time on this place. Suffice it to say, we wont be back.

ScVwenXUyp6SO40lF6MmvA.text: Decent food, but nothing awesome. Overpriced in my opinion. The menu is extremely limited -- out of perhaps 10 entrees, three were Italian. Not really a bar and grill. I had the chicken Calabrese ($25) -- two pieces of chicken with a few cherry tomatoes, a couple of tiny grilled onions and peppers in a nice sauce. That was it -- it would've killed them to pipe a few mashed potatoes around the edge? Something more than just chicken in a pan? My friend had fish and chips ($21). Fish was 6-7 smallish pieces, nicely done and the steak fries were yummy.  The service is definitely lacking. We had to ask for the malt vinegar, we had to ask for water refills, and nobody ever came by to say "is everything all right?" This place is definitely bare bones. No bread basket, the entrees don't come with even a basic salad, and there is no salt and pepper on the table. That always irks me as in "the chef knows what he's doing and if you can't appreciate the subtlety of his expertise, you shouldn't be eating here. There's a Denny's down the street, you peasant."   In reading these reviews, I see there is some kind of Yelp perk, so I would definitely go through them if I ever go back -- which I don't plan to do.

ECLBAB1uKOmm61IKPzPYWg.text: We had a wonderful dinner here the other night.  The service is very efficient and friendly and the food is amazing.  We ordered some appetizers and they were delicious, but the star of the evening was the fish, I ordered the Idaho Trout and my wife the Sea Bass, they were phenomenal, very well prepared and so delicious that I could have ordered another one for myself. The sauce was super tasty and added more flavor to the fish.  And we also loved the sides, broccolini, caramelized corn and the Fava beans was really good.  My wife loves the cheesecake here.  We can't wait to go back.  This is the best restaurant off the strip in Las Vegas.  And we really like that it is a celebrity chef restaurant that we can afford to go to.  Wonderful experience!

photos.caption: Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Idaho Trout
Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Sea Bass
Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Memorable experience!

v1MbQHKdd8oUvU6d2991OA.text: The DTS hidden gem! Isn't a bad thing on the menu. If you are a foodie, head over.  You won't be disappointed and with the addition of Auggie managing the staff the last 4-5 months, the service has totally turned around.

KJP3KCrR7K7Gi63n25J6lA.text: Just had a great lunch! Perfect fish tacos! Awesome avocado toast! Yummy chicken salad sandwich!  Came in to buy the fresh bread & decided to stay for lunch. Great idea. Ed, our server, was helpful & attentive!! Thanks Ed!

D4V7VdqALwcEe5yNrM6bUw.text: Visited this place on a quick impromptu trip to Vegas. My friend found the place, and we are soo happy he did. First of all, the pancakes.. the pancakes.. the pancakes!!! Get the pancakes!! Best pancakes I ever had in my life. I also ordered the eggs and potatoes, and those were delicious as well. I usually can't eat a lot all at once..but that didn't even matter here. I will say that I didn't enjoy the mimosa's too much, maybe the brand of champagne wasn't to my taste, but that doesn't take away from my great experience here. The scenery just adds to the perfection, palm trees, outside seating.. its lush and beautiful. I will be back.

ZXxmIGnrLegvvLWzKxAU8Q.text: Moving from 2 stars to 3 from my previous visit. Can't say enough about the friendly and great service we received from the staff.   The calamari and shrimp appetizer was really good. All the other lunch items were as mediocre as our entrees from our first visit. Disappointing and based on other reviews it seems that this is a hit or miss experience. Down the road I might consider a return visit.

-XM4sQ9GpFpyTtLVOM32zA.text: What a great place to have lunch. I brought a few clients here and our expectations were not only met but exceeded. A big thank you to the staff, especially Jason for the excellent service he provided during our experience. I/We will definitely be repeat business. Thanks again!

UtHUT8ZNLKKZ-w9qlmlLoA.text: We came here for Mother's Day and the food was great and ambiance was fantastic! Only downfall was the disappearance of our server. He was very nice but for several times, he was nowhere to be found! It was at the end of the night so I'm almost positive that he was doing his closing duties but still, don't leave your tables hanging because you want to get out of there. Speed up the process for closing and be attentive to your last tables so we can pay & leave, then you can finish up your duties and go home!

OZPNSihrre39GplRXjDllg.text: You need a new front end staff that actually pays attention to customers. Good thing it's located in downtown summerlin and you have plenty of other options.

X7eRxlfhy8AfEUPJJlcnLQ.text: Great spot for brunch! Do not leave until you have the truffled chips with blue cheese fondue! Amazing! My wife ordered the steak and eggs, equally as good. I got the eggs Benedict. If you are a fan of eggs Benedict, definitely try it. Probably the best I've ever had! Overall, if you are in the neighborhood, give it a chance, you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bomb ass steak and eggs!
Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing eggs Benedict!

XoZBCWQUwIbq98VLfgNE4w.text: Food was good but very very small portions during happy hour.  Service was so good when we first walked in at 430. Then all hell broke loose.  The service just went into the toilets at shift change. They could care less about us. Not one of the two bartenders gave us any consideration. They only serve regulars. And at this rate regulars will be extinct soon.

YLyDK8cxaL3vAaU2qRF-NA.text: stopped in last night @ 7:30PM. Was seated on the patio. waited 40 mins. before the drinks arrived. they arrived only after our second complaint that we hadn't received anything. Place was NOT busy. Plenty of tables.   Food was good. but, good food is available all over las vegas.

6SR93RDNjbavePKA0YD0ew.text: Had a girl's night here last night, and this place was perfect for drinks and small dishes. I heard they have great house wines here, and I can attest to that! I really enjoyed my Rose (not too sweet but light and fruity) and also their Moscow Mule.   We ordered the Heirloom Caprese, Crispy Calamari, Artisanal Charcuterie Platter, Salmon Tartare Potato Chips, and Spiced Cauliflower. Among these, I enjoyed the Heirloom Caprese since it was fresh and tangy, and the mozzarella on the Caprese was perfectly melted over fresh tomatoes. The Artisanal Charcuterie Platter was packed with flavor, and the cured cuts of meat were really tasty with the cheese varieties and toasted bread. I also think this was a good choice since it pairs well with wine. The Spiced Cauliflower was a popular favorite among my group, but I personally felt it to be a bit bland.   I didn't enjoy the Salmon Tartare Potato Chips and the Crispy Calamari too much. The salmon was lacking tanginess or flavor or something, it just was forgettable. With the crispy calamari, it wasn't as crispy as I would have liked and some pieces felt a bit soggy and it also was lacking in the flavor component.   For the main courses, we ordered the Rigatoni, which for me was nothing special. However, I loved their Sausage Pizza! The crust was perfect and so was the ratio of cheese to sausage. The bread here in general is yum, including the free bread.   I would have given this place a 5 since the service was phenomenal and the experience was great, but just a few dishes for me fell short. I would definitely come back for the Pizza and the Wine!

photos.caption: Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cauliflower. Crowd Favorite
Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salmon Tartare 4/5
Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Calamari.. meh

_qaeVh3JexwKJ0JHk7FEJQ.text: Half of the happy hour menu here is a joke. Some of the offerings included $9 fried calamari. Which at most places would be great, except that it was for literally 9 pieces of small calamari. $1 per small piece of fried calamari is insane. I don't think I've seen that at any other place before. On top of that the $8 chicken wings for the happy hour menu was for 4 pieces of chicken. That's $2 per piece of chicken. Just take a look at the attached pictures. I still can't believe the food portions we received.   Some of the slightly more reasonable offerings include the truffle potato chips at $5, the chicken nachos, and the fries. I absolutely hate that one can slap on a celebrity chef name onto bar food and call it fancy and think it's okay to charge absurd prices for small portions of food even for happy hour. NOT ON MY WATCH!

YjGUMxb97f2WNFlx0kIoew.text: Went in today for a drink and lunch after a morning full of Christmas shopping and still have only good things to say about the experience. We were seated right away and Our order was taken very quickly, we had a Moscow Mule and a Berry Mojito to start off and they were both very good (Kudos to the Bartender). Hubby ordered the bbq chicken pizza and I ordered the Hummus w/flatbread. Just enough to satisfy our appetite as we still had a little more shopping to do. Our waitress was Awesome. I can honestly say I have never been dissatisfied with the service or the food here.

photos.caption: Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Hummus with flatbreat
Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Moscow Mule and Blackberry Mojito
Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Bbq chicken pizza

vMCYqWp228IQm2PjBJ8giw.text: Yikes! This place was such a disappointment... We were seated right away on the outdoor patio. That's pretty much where the quick service stopped and for a Friday night at 8pm, partially filled restaurant, the service was pretty bad.   Our waitress came by several minutes later to greet us and get our drink orders, but by then we also knew what we wanted to eat so we put our order in all at once and only ordered appetizers to share. We had ordered 2 glasses of wine and waited nearly 25 mins for those to come out. We actually considered getting up and leaving as nor our wine or food had come out yet, but figured it would be more of hassle to find another restaurant, walk to it with a baby, sit and order food all over again then to just sit and wait here instead. So we waited some more and finally 2 of our 4 appetizers came out just before our wine. I noticed we had no utensils to eat with, so luckily the waitress hadn't darted away yet and I was able to let her know.   It wouldn't of been such an annoyance if we were just paid attention too. It was like, all the guests seated in the patio were left to fend for themselves. Even the 3 girls that were seated after us were left there. The waitress noticed our annoyance and offered us a complimentary dessert which were cookies. COOKIES. Which was nice, I guess, but also took another 20 minutes to get. What would've been a better recovery solution was if she just took off the extra $3 charge, that she charged us for, for ordering veggie sticks to eat with our hummus plate.   $100 later and with all of that being said, going to In N Out would've been the better choice.

yVNaLVcGad5bP2VugbEhRQ.text: Best Short Ribs in Town! I'd Rather have lunch here than any other place in town !! Always Fresh & Dependable ! The staff are always eager to please ! I just had my birthday lunch here last month and it was fabulous

at3WcjBi9nKXrH7ILHsS0A.text: Finally gave this place a visit for happy hour. The vibe and ambience of this place is great, I really liked the look of the place and it was comfortable.  Sat at the bar about 5 minutes before HH ended and the bartender was able to get my order in quickly. I got an order of the salt&pepper wings, parmesan fries and calamari. The food was pretty tasty, out of all my favorite were the wings. Definitely try those they are full of flavor. The only down side is that you only get 4!! The fries were a good portion and the calamari was good as well.  Can't forget the liquor - I tried the Summerlin Sour and this cocktail is probably what's gonna keep bringing me back. So refreshing, tasteful and the texture with the egg whites was perfect. Ended up having 3 with my girlfriend. Must try!  4/5 stars because I wasn't amazed with the happy hour food choices, but next time I will have to try the main menu.

Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Delicious Summerlin Sour

l9HUPOORn8rpvWo_udNW_A.text: I come to this place often for lunch. They are very consistent here and I'm always satisfied with level of service and food quality. It might be a little pricier versus your normal Applebee's/chilies but this place has excellent food. The ambiance is a bit rustic, contemporary. I recommend this place for any occasion, including staff lunches. The usually get a salad with chicken, and oh man, it's amazing! Leave room for the golden knight puck dessert!

photos.caption: Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Golden Knight Puck Dessert
Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Salad with chicken

DKfBHv760exjCzqbB-KUXA.text: Was always a favorite, now not so much. Always changing the menu, took away the locals discount and not the same vibe. Note to the big bosses-You can't keep changing up a local's restaurant like you do a strip restaurant.

photos.caption: Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Amazing new happy hour addition; Brats! Best happy hour in town.

YBHvNRsmJlu0Bmn4U1IExw.text: The food and the service were as good as each other. I ordered the Braised Beef Shortribs entree. It came with roasted roots on the side (small carrots, shallots & potatoes), polenta and gremolata. The vegetables were very tasty, with perfect spices. Simplicity and flavors both shined on this plate. The rib meat was large and fall-apart delicious. It had a savory barbequed glaze. When I say fall-apart, I really mean it. Even cutting across the grain posed no need for a knife. It was perfectly cooked, served on top of a small bed of creamy polenta and topped with gremolata.   I usually only drink water when I eat, and this meal was no different. A quick inquiry by the server determined that I like mine tepid, with no ice. My request was met with sincerity. Most servers would never have bothered to ask, or remember. During my meal, I was met by no less than three servers, and possibly one manager, all asking me if everything was ok, and if they could get me anything that I might want. Great service, even though 95% of the place was full.   I was seated inside right away, where it was very full and busy. I dined alone on this occasion, being lunch. The full menu is available during business hours. It's all one big menu, not separated like what the website shows. Some dinner selections I saw on the menu had different details from what I saw online. So, I believe their website is out-of-date.   A Vegas Golden Knights team jesey is displayed on the wall with the name PUCK. See the photo! I look forward to my return to this restaurant. I remember visiting the WP Bar & Grill restaurant at the MGM a few years ago. I was surprised at the combined quality and price. In visiting this location, I was not let down one bit. Good job, everybody! Thanks!

KdgVpXTGu2uUqQgo4rp1VA.text: This spot is located in a nice shopping, culinary and entertaining area of Summerlin. I arrived around 6pm and there was no wait. I ordered the Grilled Flat Iron Steak (medium) with the Parmesan Fries and Chimichurri (I'm assuming that's either the onions that topped the steak. I should google it.)  It didn't take long for the food to arrive. The fries were fries... nothing spectacular. I asked if they had blue cheese dressing (for my fries) and the server said that he would check! Lo and behold... they didn't! BUT the made some for me!!! How cool is that? That joint was delicious! I should have gotten their recipe.  The steak was grilled perfectly! And it tasted great! The onions were great too. I ate most of them by themselves. I finished my fries first, so I could enjoy my steak. I dipped the steak in the blue cheese and it made the steak that much more betterer! I should have gotten that recipe!  It's not a "must eat here" restaurant for future visits, but I know it's an option when I'm back here with the Mrs and she wants a nice dinner away from The Strip!

RFULIxAnfI4jyJ5doyJAWQ.text: Bad experience, ordered 1/2 chicken for $25 & it was the smallest chicken I ever seen maybe the size of 1/4 . Comes with no sides, so I ordered a side (they forgot to put in in) . I left hungry after spending a $125 for 3 people. Never will go back.   Well I went back for happy hour, what a ripoff, they lowered the prices & down sized portions so it all comes back to regular prices. The calamari (rip-off)  Just a small amount for $9 & I mean SMALL I probably would have been better off ordering off regular menu.  Yes $5 wine but they made up for it on everything else. I don't understand restaurants that have happy hour but really don't want to have happy hour because they don't want to give up there profit margins that they are use to, so why do they do it ???? Go somewhere else, that's my advice. The best part that gets me is do they think we are dumb? I find it insulting .

8q02oiv2H-FvyshWc0stTQ.text: AGain I went hoping it would be better but again ridiculously expensive for happy hour and again with the children in a bar. As an adult woman going out for a drink at 5:30pm, the last thing I expect at a bar are 7 year old children sitting with their "single" parents, Absolutely unfun and inappropriate and certainly not meant for a happy hour type of atmosphere. Again the drinks are $13 each. Again it is a waste of my money and time. Last time for me. I have never seen children at a place for adults in a bar setting. How ridiculous is that? is that parenting or what? Are there any adult men and women having a social time there?   Count me out. Sorry I lost my money there.

y0sHkr14-bo5X2StZCiR2w.text: Not the best place for happy hour food. Not much selection for alcohol either. They don't even have well drinks on happy hour. The food portions are tiny! I ordered korean bbq wings & you get 4 pieces for $10. The salmon tartare tacos ($10) is so small it is literally 1 big bite or 2 small bites. The truffle cheese arancini ($6) is so tiny, it is 1 bite. You get 3 of those. So many happy hour places in DTS, go somewhere else!

PVzm_sxLuXEXXZi7t7ZnPA.text: First time here for dinner. Ian our waiter is new to the restaurant, but he knew wverything on the drink and food menu. 5 yelp stars for Ian (soelling might be off). Best thing was that he was only familiar with the yelp check in promo at Spago, but he asked his manager about the yelp checkin at Wolfgang summerlin and figured it out promptly.   He recommended the old fashioned, i like old fashioned's and enjoyed the flavor of their version. A little bit on the sweeter side, but a great way to introduce a girl to the classic bourbon drink.   Starters we had happy hour appetizers which are every day from 3-7pm. Yay for extended happy hour time! We had the calamari and chicken nachos. Everything came out hot and cooked perfectly.  Entrees we had the braised short rib, brick chicken, and the rigatoni. Very delicious Short rib was super tender, very tasty and the mashed potato was wonderfully seasoned. I didn't try my friend's chicken, but they said it was very good, not dry. Just noce and juicy. My rigatoni pasta was a little undercooked, was a little salty, but with a little bit of the cheese, it cuts the saltyness. One little downside didn't hurt my experience at all.   Dessert was red velvet cheesecake, it had a nice dark chocolate mousse between he cheesecake and the red velvet crust.

_M4wBDmyaE6va7Ina7QheA.text: This was our 2nd time going to this location and the 1st time was better than this time. The service was just ok and the food was too.   Ordered: Meatballs 4/5 stars  Tender, juicy, and full of flavor. The sauce was amazing. I couldn't give it a 5 stars because I asked for extra basil and cheese and they did not bring it out that way. :-(  Margarita pizza with sausage added: 2/5 stars  The pizza came out with no sausage ;-(  the waiter took it back to the kitchen and came out 2 secs later so the sausage was just thrown on top :-(  The lack of cheese was so disappointing. :-(  Fish and chips: 3/5  My boyfriend order this dish and he said it was good. Nothing was great about it to give it more than 3 stars. Fish was flaky and the fries were nice and crispy.

vnioTj129JZDBvd4Ng6yVA.text: There are so many choices for restaurants in downtown Summerlin, but Wolfgang Puck stands out as our number one choice all the time. We live the food here, the quality is top notch and the service is always genuine and friendly. My daughter loves the spaghetti meatballs from the kids menu which has a very good variety as well. They have great pizzas, amazing fish and really good hamburger too. We always order the homemade potato chips with blue cheese, it's addictive! If you like Mexican flavors you can always find a good option on the menu as well, I love to start off with the tortilla soup, it's delicious. Overall, this is a great restaurant to bring your family for a nice meal and I highly recommend seating outside in the patio area when the weather is nice. Deiandra was our server and she did a wonderful job. Very hospitable.

EypHRlc0G2DbNhOTKpgO0A.text: My server was amazing and extremely friendly. The pear martinis are a must try. Honestly the best thing I've ever tasted. The food was delicious as well. The chicken Alfredo was very good pasta cooked perfectly.

AdgHDlNKr3LoyVBwsZfwmA.text: Nice atmosphere.. that's about all. The food was mediocre at best and hilariously overpriced. Happy hour only available at the bar so pretty much everyone in the restaurant with the exception of about 12 people who can sit at the bar can enjoy. Our server was nice but nearly had to flag him down a few times go get him to come to our table for water refill and our check. Won't be going back again.

cORcqo1dt_Bmu1j0LrFRgw.text: Five of us enjoyed the friendly and professional service of KYLE. She was helpful, attentive and fun. Kyle's service, and that of her floor team was a 5. Unfortunately her floor manager, Ian, was a 1. Ian was much more interested in two young ladies seated next to us and persisted in "entertaining" them with a very loud voice for over ten minutes, the first time! The second time he introduced the chef, nice touch, but continued with a very loud voice for another 7-8 minutes. Not once did he visit another table to share his wisdom. Too bad!  A management tip: train Ian on total customer service and managing the customer experience.

zOzoNrnNBujEHZ5gaJGLQQ.text: Sunday Brunch is one of my favorite things in life, especially when it involves bottomless mimosas with fresh-squeezed juice.   When my buddy and I arrived, we were greeted warmly and seated quickly. The service was all-around great.  In addition to the mimosas, I chose to order the Huevos Rancheros. The sauce was some of the best I've had for this dish. Creamy avocado, black beans, egg and cotija cheese made this dish a hit in my book.   My buddy ordered the Lobster Benedict. I am a little shy when it comes to anything seafood, but this dish was great. It wasn't an overpowering fishy taste, the eggs were perfectly poached, and the hollandaise sauce was nice and creamy.  Looking forward to coming back some time to try their other dishes.

2ss1-FqJq4LNXPz0tUrbQA.text: The Margherita pizza is out of this world! It's seriously my new favorite pizza! The sauce is really flavorful and the crust is delicious! Plus, the wood fired pizza oven makes it extra amazing. Okay, enough about that... The waiters and waitresses are very professional and they know their stuff. I also really like the ambiance here. The restaurant has an industrial cool vibe, not too stuffy. The patio is really nice too, when it isn't hot out. The prices are on the high side, but I always get the pizza ($14), so I can't complain.

lGtupsRJTosDmbZu_-f3yA.text: I think the key is to arrive early and beat the crowd. We had eaten at other Wolf Gang Pucks in the past with just ok food and service. We arrived around  4:30 and sat off the bar area. Everyone from the hostess, bartender, and server were great. Food was excellent as were the drinks. qlwbik0KJJRB2p6KDDh2HA.text: Had an excellent lunch today in Downtown Summerlin at Wolfgang Puck. Upon arrival they were pretty busy but we were greeted with a warm welcome and seated promptly. I was able to enjoy their special of the day which was a chicken salad sandwich with cranberry walnut bread and sprouts, amazing! Wolfgang yet again ceases to amaze!

d-wO8ux9K7wyX79t6EeSug.text: Our first visit to the new Wolfgang was fantastic!  Zoe, our server, was friendly and knowledgable.  When it was time for Zoe to leave the manager came over to make sure we were ok with it.  Nice touch.    Neither of us were super hungry so we were looking for small and light.  I had the Big Eye Tuna Tartare as my entree and it was delish.  Hubby had the Chinese Chicken Salad which had the biggest cashews I've ever seen on it.  He said it was perfectly dressed.  Not too sweet.  We shared the Baked sweet potato which was super creamy.    Ya, I know...random combo of food. ..but it hit the spot and was very tasty!

3enMYeXTDtgMS7I5Pnng9Q.text: Food was great, super yummy. Service was awful though, super disappointed again. I wanted my family to try this place because the food is great and they don't have Wolfgang Puck everywhere but I am definitely not coming back again. There literally were no other tables aside from us and our waiter did not care to ask us if we were okay, for refills, and it took her forever to even come to our table in the first place. You pay 100 dollars for a meal and you expect a little better service, don't you think? I guess just stick to CUT by Wolfgang Puck, they have way better service but it's also at the strip and you are spending about 400 + dollars for your meal so maybe they train them better there.

KhoP17lQZ1qv8c_HcZOjCw.text: I would never eat there again. Wanted to try it but was so disappointed. Ordered garlic bread. The bread was about 2 inches wide was $7 cut into 3 tiny pieces. Chicken salad $17 had a few tiny shreds of chicken. Think Wolfgang needs a donation. Cheap bastard.  Food was not tasty n the portions were measly. Would not recommend anyone going there.

tJ7lQQOA1IWER4akMSKbtg.text: One of the better restaurants in downtown summerlin for sure. Wolfgang your trademark name once again delivers. The restaurant is pretty upscale and even the door to get in is huge and imposing but I definitely dig it.   Obviously food matters most so lets get right into it:  -Free range chicken wings. I think these are pretty great. I have spoken to people who say otherwise and I get their point, they arent crispy that is True. They have a thick glaze and arent fried but I don't mind that texture. The glaze is great with a small amount of kick. I could eat a lot of these  -Hand made meatballs. Very yummy no question. You can go to all kinds of restaurants and get a meh meatball but this is not one of them. Worth a taste  -Cheese and meat board. Pretty good I'd say. Nothing blew me away but it's cheese and meat and all of them were edible and fairly enjoyable.  -Prosciutto Arugula pizza. I dont see this on the menu so it may have been a special. Not quite my favorite. I've had plenty of these pizzas before and usually like them but the cheese prosciutto and arugula ratios were way off. The arugula amount overpowered everything else and make the pizza bitter.  -Rigatoni Pasta. Delicious and very filling. Bolognese sauce is great as is the ricotta. It's simple and a great meal no question.  So, the place isn't perfect that's for sure. I haven't loved everything I've tried but it's definitely more likely to be a hit than a miss on any given night. I've gone a handful of times and expect to go again. I recommend you do the same.

RTS3aJju8-82zYzLHuaS2Q.text: I love their trendy setting. Took about 10 min to be seated, which is not bad being I went on a Friday night around 7:30pm. I offered the Pearfect Martini, very delicious and included vodka and pear syrup.  For appetizer we ordered the chips with warm truffle cheese and blue cheese crumbles, very good. As well we had the fried calamari, the marinara sauce was also great. And finally me and my friend split the papardelli pasta with ox meat, good thing we did because the entree would of being too big for just me. The ox meat is shredded, and you can tell the pasta is home made which the server did confirm.   I wish I remember the server's name but I was impressed that at the end of our meal he came up to me and asked me about the food but actually then asked me to really critique it and mention what we didn't like or could of been better. I said the chips had a good amount of cheese but I personally would of liked more cheese. And for the calamari it could of been a little more crisper, but still very good. And I had no complaint at all about the papardelli.

RF23hj1i4LY2eWBX-D6Ycw.text: What a great addition to the new Downtown Summerlin!   The first time I went was just for some cocktails with 3 other girls and we sat on the outdoor patio. We loved our large drink selection and the cool vibe they created.   My second visit was a date night with my husband and another couple. Our server Jason was awesome! He was knowledgable about all the random food questions we had. Which was a lot. As busy as the restaurant was, we got all of our food in a timely manner and everything tasted delicious! Steak, french fries, pizza, chicken, and mashed potatoes. Yummy yummy yummy!

yvSqIw0n_dFXuSG5IYi5lg.text: Went there for lunch, saw that they had allergy menu,  but the only thing was that bartender staff during happy hour did not understand my allergy and messed up my order twice .   They need to make sure staff understands allergies and what cross contaminated is , So I got a couple avocado rolls and left

aQj2tAULi2SX55fkDHtqDg.text: It's located at the heart of downtown summerlin, great location but average food quality. Service was okay. We ordered mussels in white wine sauce might be the best of all, the rest was not too impressive. Have tried few Wolfgang's restaurants in town, I think the receipt are very standard, I'd much rather give Loco chef a try!

51iyFMdiZewZ8302jw05Ag.text: Service could not be worse...a waiter with an attitude? Good luck with that. Food is average...Management is obviously dropping the ball, not training or hiring appropriate staff.  Wolfgang. .. I'm telling Ramsey on you.

ZU-D0AbbHtc-7bY0F5P2lA.text: Pretty good spot to grab a bite if you're up in the Downtown Summerlin mall area!  Like Wolfgang's other places, this restaurant is consistent and also offers of good selection of tasty delights.    For my drink, I had the daily healthy fresh pressed juice.  Today's special was spinach, kale, celery, ginger, orange, and apple.  It's not bad combo and tasted alright.  For the appetizer we had the calamari, roasted vegetable pizza, and a side of french fries.  The calamari was awesome, two sauces for you to dip your calamari and some battered veggies as well.  The roasted pizza was very good as well, the broccolini added a nice texture to the pizza.  Normally I like a meaty type of pizza, but for a change I decided to try the roasted vegetable pizza and I'm glad I did.  Nothing special about the fries, skinny type fries, but the nice thing is the side of fries is a nice hearty portion and great for sharing.  For dinner we had the mushroom pasta and a side of broccolini.  The mushroom pasta had great flavor, but the one thing I wasn't a fan of was some of the pasta had clumps of salt which made it really salty for some bites.  The brocolini stir fry side was a nice compliment to the meal, a little subtle spicy kick to it.    As for dessert, we had the apple crotada.  Basically, a fresh baked open faced apple pastry with a side of vanilla ice cream.  Since it's fresh baked, it takes a few minutes longer.  This was really good, the pastry was very flaky and warm right out of the oven.  The apples weren't too sweet and a little tart which I like.  Definitely a dessert I'd get again.  Service at the table was pretty good.  The odd thing is with the hostess, we got there and had to sit at the community table since we didn't make a reservation per the hostess even though 80% of the restaurant wasn't full at that time.  Even after we were done with our meal, paid and got up to leave the main dining area they had about 40% of the main dining area open not counting the outside patio dining area that no one really sat at since it's cold outside.  It seemed odd to push people to the community table to sit next to each other when it wasn't super busy.  Maybe the hostess was still training, but I'd recommend making a reservation given our experience if you and your party want a more private dining experience.

Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mushroom pasta and a side of broccolini

jGRopdUzp-nsLHCchC7OSg.text: I love this place because it's close to my house and the food is good! Service is good...drinks are good...shout out to Bri! It's also very quick you can be in and out which is nice. Staff is friendly and quick to deliver that mouth watering salmon pizza to your table

TI8Tx5MZNoluRhgzN_UblQ.text: My husband and I had dinner at Wolfgang Puck's on Tuesday, November 1.  We enjoyed the Truffle Chips to start, along with a delicious Old Fashioned and Indian Sunset beverages.  The order of chips was huge- plenty to share, but we wanted to save room for our steaks.    My hubby had the Flat Iron with French Fries, and I had the Grilled Ribeye.  Both were delicious!  The food came out hot, and stayed warm while we dined.    The ambiance was nice- obviously you're in the middle of a casino, and the restaurant has no walls, so you can hear the noise- but it wasn't bad at all.    Our server was AWESOME!  I'm disappointed we can't remember his name ... possibly Zak.  He gave us great menu ideas, brought out a delicious bottle of Cabernet (Justin), and was very attentive.    All in all we had a wonderful time at Wolfgang Puck's, and we will return!

fdUqpkJCB_dWJtYL_K_Y5w.text: The man that sat us was very friendly. We've heard great things about the pizza we were going to order but unfortunately we didn't get to try anything because we were never greeted, a server never came to our table. After we sat there for at least 10 minutes we got up and left. It wasn't even busy

9mequMVVrIBYjJny1rlhBA.text: BEST KEPT SECRET IN SOUTHERN NEVADA!  As i write this review, i'm torn!  On the one hand, i have been enjoying this spectacular dining experience for weeks, practically by myself and i love it!  I WANT TO KEEP THE SECRET!  On the other hand, i owe the dining public, who appreciate fantastic food opportunities, the opportunity to share in this wonderful dining experience.  I would NOT want anyone to hold out on me, after all.   If you are fortunate enough to get a spot at Wolfgang Puck's table at this location (this is the brainchild of David Robins) [HINT:  make a reservation] you will be treated to a three course special meal, totally at the discretion of the Chef for $25 including a glass of WP wine plus tip!  On top of this, on the second Tuesday of every month this location offers (generous) free samples of spectacular wine from around the world to all diners in the restaurant plus they bring in an amazing singer with a vast repertoire on those Tuesdays.   So what do you get for that meager fare - $25?  First they start your off with an amuse bouche - i have had a crab cake, a tomato shooter, tomato basil soup, the whole gambit. Then you get what the Italians would call a secondo piatti, i have had pappardella with a meat sauce that was sublime -- among many others.  Then the "peaches of resistance," comes -- Chef Chris likes to bring this dish out personally in a tajine for the element of surprise -- the three most memorable dishes were two fish dishes, one salmon and another bass and the most amazing was shrimp on a skewer in a curry coconut sauce -- it was so beautiful. They take a real farm-to-table approach with their food -- everything is fresh and tasty and cooked to perfection.  For dessert lovers, they have the most amazing pastry chef that makes some of the best -- homemade chocolate pudding, strawberry shortcake, and the most amazing white chocolate cake with raspberry sorbet!  Again, i hesitate to share this because i ALWAYS WANT my spot at the table.  However, i would be derelict in my duties as a foodie if i did not tell a few others about this amazing feast for a small price for some of the best food in Las Vegas.  You owe it to yourself to treat yourself to this amazing opportunity soon -- i don't know how long this will last, but while it does -- Go FOR IT! PS they also do the most amazing ribs on the weekend that are, as they say, "to die for."

nQozIUJyl_0mW7mHjVxYvQ.text: This has been one of my favorite restaurants to go to. My boyfriend and I come every other week and so - sometimes we sit at the kitchen table, there is really great energy watching the chef and cooks making the food and bantering back and forth. Overall the food is amazing- the Chinese chicken salad and Prosciutto Pizza are "MUST HAVE" dishes. I would also add the Truffle Potato chips are to die for, but an infrequent guilty pleasure. My boyfriend and I got seated with the server James our first time and really such a nice guy and great service... we request him every time and we started picking up his historical mantra "I'm killing it" around the house. Automatically when we come in he knows what we want or will suggest good specials. One night my boyfriend and I came to Wolfgang feeling kinda down from a long day and we left feeling uplifted with huge smiles on our faces, thanks to James! The whole staff is super nice and the food comes quick. So happy to speak on both of our behalf that Wolfgang has become a family ritual.

jf9Pov3YOiGihxBbubylAw.text: Nestled in beautiful downtown Summerlin, we had a great relaxing dinner here. The menu was great and easy to navigate. It is classic American style food here.   FOOD: Delicious! Very rich flavors and everything tasted fresh. We had a Caprese salad to start and that was so refreshing and light. It was the perfect starter to our dinner. Our main courses were equally as good and very filling. I had the Fettuccine Alfredo with wild mushrooms, sauteed spinach and it was soooo good. Tasted so fresh and was just the right amount.   AMBIANCE: Very dim in there during happy hour. As it gets darker, they'll turn up the lighting of course. It looks somewhat rustic but very trendy and hip.   SERVICE: Excellent service! Our waiter Alex was very pleasant. Our food came very quickly.   DRESS CODE: Casual

Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-ropvM-0lzm2t9fKXi4DTw.text: We went here for brunch for the first time and it was less than great. To start off, our server brought us water, but after that, we didn't have anyone come to our table for 15-20 minutes. We finally ordered our bottomless mimosas. It took a while to get our mimosas and we ordered calamari to start and spaghetti and meatballs and chicken Alfredo for our entrees. We got the calamari and it was super bland and under seasoned. My spaghetti was okay and my boyfriend's chicken Alfredo was also super bland.   Once we paid, we saw our server leave but expected to still be served mimosas. We thought wrong. We had empty glasses for a good 20 minutes. I finally flagged down a busser and asked for more mimosas. 5 minutes later, he brings the group of girls seated across from us two carafes of mimosas. We waited 10 more minutes and saw the busser continue cleaning. I had to ask the bartender for more drinks and we finally received 2 glasses.   Overall, the food was overpriced and pretty bland and the service was lacking. What a disappointment.

0XKFtYiSW-Kw50cOFnN-Gg.text: This place has a very limited dinner menu. Overpriced and you can only get the happy hour specials at the bar. I asked our server and he said I would have to order the drink at the bar. Horrible customer service.  I also asked if I could get fried chicken on my Caesar salad and they said no.    The place also does not run air conditioning during the day it was so hot in there that maybe were requesting to change tables away from the windows.    I will not go back, I would have been better off going to shake shack next door instead if of wasting $100 at this place. It sucks.

CgtUi7UgfKNl9LS5Qw-sXA.text: We went for lunch on Friday with 4 adults and 2 small children, and it was a nice dining experience.  We were first seated right next to the door to the outdoor dining patio.  It was about 105 degs outside, and we had no desire to enjoy the hot air wafting in from the door, so we asked to move.  They were very nice about it, and moved our waters and effects to a new table.  We ordered apps: Meatballs, Chicken Nachos, and Shrimp Scampi.  All were delicious, with nice sized portions.  We then went with entrees; Brick Chicken, Salmon Bowl, Fish Tacos, and a burger.  All were well prepared and tasty.  The service was excellent, with refills coming often and plates cleared rapidly.  They lost a star because they are a bit overpriced.  I realize it is a Puck establishment, but $28 for half a small baked chicken?  Overall; nice place to eat, but bring your wallet.
