Wttraay33W1BqPFDb343jQ.text: What a difference a year and a half makes. And not a good difference. I think it's time for an update.  Change is constant, and usually it's not for the better. That's certainly True in this case. Since my first review, I've been back to Wolfgang Puck at this location several times, sometimes for Happy Hour, sometimes not. But since my last visit, lots of things have disappeared - the extended HH hours, the discount for locals, but most important, the items on the menu that made us keep coming back.  Gone is the fabulous burger. Also gone is the salad with goat cheese. The HH menu is a shell of its former self. White wine? Choice of one, Chardonnay. Not my fave, but I know I'm an outlier. Beer at $5 isn't bad, until you see the size.  DH had the meatballs, two balls for $9, with sauce. I don't like the taste of pork in meatballs, so we didn't share. I had a hard time finding something to eat, and finally decided on Cheese Curds, which our waitress pronounced as "delicious." I've had better, and I paid for all that fried and salty goo-meal for the rest of the night. If you go to the website and try to find any of the menus for this place, it'll lead you down a rabbit hole. Well hidden, and apparently not current enough. Those cheese curds aren't there. Unless they removed them since yesterday.  I did check the regular menu, but pretty much stopped at the Crab Cake appetizer when I saw it was $19. And that's just an appetizer. Oh, and that elusive hamburger was there, too, for $17. Okay, it's Angus beef. But should you want to substitute a lowly veggie burger, it'll cost an extra buck. WTF???  I used to love this place. But with prices escalating to near-Strip levels, I think I'll stick with more interesting ethnic restaurants.

2OlIa1qd1QO2KxHza4jNlg.text: I've walked past this place so many times, but never actually came in. I'm so glad some friends and I finally decided to check them out for a happy hour. First off, I love anywhere that offers 4-7 pm HHs since I usually get done with work around 6. This place is beautiful inside, very modern and classy. The location is always easy to get to (right across from Shake Shack).   We decided to order basically everything on the HH menu and then some. Drink wise, the molecule mules were great and super cheap! For food my favorites were the salmon tartar tacos, chips & onion dip, and the truffle chips. The wings were alright, but needed a bit more sauce and I wasn't a huge fan of the buffalo  cauliflower (my personal taste). We also had some cookies and carrot cake for desserts. Both were very sweet & delicious.  I highly recommend this place for a tasty & cute HH. I'll have to come back another time for dinner or brunch.

The highlights were for sure the fish tacos and the eggs Benedict, the avocado toast was very good but the tacos fell short. sZo9jY-Av5hyh5YlvPg_Cg.text: *** Review is for Restaurant Week 2018 menu ***  Even though Wolfgang Puck's Bar and Grill has been in the neighborhood for almost three years, this was my first time eating here.  I looked at the RW menu and decided this would be a good way to test the food and service.  This was a $40 RW menu.  For the three courses, I chose the Baja shrimp ceviche with tostada crisps.  The ceviche had red pepper in it and on the rim of the glass.  There were pieces of avocado on the top of the ceviche.  After eating most of the ceviche, I lifted the glass and drank the remaining juices and got some good pepper taste.  The main I chose was the black pepper pappardelle with wild boar ragu and pecorino cheese.  The runner asked if I wanted pepper or parmesan and I asked for parmesan.  He came back with a small contained with freshly shredded cheese that I added to the pappardelle.  For dessert, I ordered the salted caramel pretzel tart.    The main course was the star of the dinner.  The ceviche was good but the glass was so packed it made it a bit difficult to eat.  I know I have some tomato to make sure is removed from my shirt when I do laundry.  The pretzel tart was OK but I expected more pretzel.  There were bits of pretzel sprinkled on top of the caramel tart and alongside the piece but that was it.   Service was excellent.

NiJQmjBK1p8hk1PBbtSRtg.text: Popped in here for a pre dinner cocktail there happy hour drinks and small treats sounded so delicious. Decided to sit at the bar and the bartender and other wait staff are a hopping fulfilling orders for waiting patrons. The bartender took my order and brought me a menu over. She was very pleasant and friendly. I have never visited a bar where the bartender comes to the tables in the bar area and floats around. I am so glad she is able to do this since it makes her job easier, fun, and more involved in the customer experience.   The heartbeat of the bar is the bartender and the individual that is running this place is highly organized and very focused. She recommended the buffalo cauliflower which was fantastically hot but the burn goes away after a bit. I had a glass of rose to start but then with buffalo anything beer is the answer. To pair with the rest of the buffalo cauliflower decided on the beer flavored Sierra Nevada Hazy Little Thing.   The ambiance of the restaurant/bar was so relaxing but still upscale enough to keep up the elegance of fine dining. The wood paneling is a great touch and so is the outside patio area which has a mist system. This being the desert with a great way to stay cool and proper shading the outside patio area is welcoming too, but I prefer good old air conditioning and cocktails indoors.

5aWmDp2wtia-2aK52r4AOg.text: This is not your typical Wolfgang Puck experience. I came to this location thinking the experience would be similar to the Caesar's Palace location...that is DEFINITELY not the case...  This review is based on my Mother's Day late time lunch. We had reservations for 3 PM but were able to get in at 130 with only a 10 minute wait. It was super loud when we got inside the dining area. My infant didn't like it at first. The menu was very basic -- was actually shocked for something that had Wolfgang's name on it. My husband I ordered the Korean Wings, Mezze Sampler, WP Burger, and Aviator Pizza. (Side note: We went to the game for a bit before we dined and there was a special for a free pizza with same day game ticket.) The waitress was very friendly and attentive with making sure my husband always had a full glass of soda. What really irked me was that our food was delivered through "auctioning off." For the prices of the food and the name associated with this establishment, I would think that the service would be top notch. I'd honestly get the same service dining at IHOP. The food was nothing special. My husband and I thought the pita bread used for the sampler was the same as the pizza dough. The wings were okay, nothing special. The burger was pretty good --very juicy and flavorful. Pizza was subpar -- lacked cheese and diverse array of flavor. The sampler was the best item we ate.   Overall, I will not return to this place. A warning sign should have been the words "Bar and Grill."

ZoHSw1CjywbyBAF32nYJFQ.text: This is a happy hour review.   The Skinny: overpriced portions for happy hour review and with the exception of the calamari wouldn't order anything else again(3), service: pretty good in the bar area (4), value: pass -  there are better places to spend your hard earned cash (3).  After purchasing some Wolfgang Puck gift cards from Costco (protip: $100 gift card for $79.99 - this is an online deal only), we still had some money leftover from a visit to Spago. So we decided to hit this place for happy hour and use up the rest of it.   The happy hour food menu consists of truffled potato chips with Maytag blue cheese fondue, cheese plate,  charcuterie plate, chicken wings,  fried calamari,  meatballs,  and pork tacos -  each dish is priced at $6.  We placed an order for the chicken wings, the calamari,  the meatballs, and the pork tacos. The hubs raised an eyebrow but I told him I didn't think the portion sizes were going to be big.   Boy was I right! We spent $24 on 2 small meatballs, 4 chicken wings, 2 bite sized tacos and calamari that I could probably fit in 1 cupped hand.  But are the prices worth it? The magic 8 ball says no.   The meatballs were okay but the marinara was overly sweet. The pork tacos didn't have that robust porkiness and was relatively bland even with the salsa. The chicken wings were nothing no to write home about and the mild Asian hot sauce didn't really distinguish itself in any particular way.   The best thing was by far the calamari. The batter was perfect and light. We loved the green ginger flavored aioli it came with.   Service was excellent with a full bar area and our water glasses were never empty.   Given what we sampled today, I would be hard pressed to return. The portion sizes for the price/quality is pretty ridiculous. 3 starred review.

sLp6gVKg7oRjTibC6wBT6g.text: The menu may not be groundbreaking, but the execution has been excellent almost every visit. Add to that a dark, comfortable dining area with views into an open kitchen and you've got a spot that has gained much popularity since opening in the new Downtown Summerlin shopping district.  Like other Wolfgang spots around town, you'll find pizzas. The Asian BBQ chicken pizza ($14) lacked enough hoisin to give it a distinct Asian flavor, but the chicken, broccoli, chiles and cilantro still made it a satisfying dish. I preferred the potato leek pizza ($12) with its sweet garlic, goat cheese and guanciale toppings. The chewy crust on both showed an ample amount of char and blisters and delivered some great flavors.  There are a handful of pasta dishes on the menu. The hand-crafted rags of pasta that make up the garganelli ($15) were impressive. The turkey bolognese sauce added much savoriness while the basil whipped ricotta added a touch of sweetness.  Among entrees simplicity seems to be the concept behind every dish. The sea bass ($34) looks like a minimally plated dish but is expertly seasoned and roasted, sitting atop a gremolata and garlic spinach. Equally bare is a tender, lean grilled New York strip ($37) topped with an herb butter coating its well charred exterior and accompanied by a handful of skinny fries. Their mesquite grilled burger ($12) won't win any awards for originality, but it's a well crafted combination of aged cheddar, red onion marmalade, and bacon aioli atop a patty larger than the bun it's in.  For dessert the bread pudding ($9) and molten chocolate cake ($9) are tried and True dishes that will satisfy your need for a sugar fix. Their best option is a flaky and buttery apple crostada ($8) with caramel and vanilla gelato.  The familiar fare may not push culinary boundaries, but it should play well to the Summerlin crowd. There are plenty of dishes that are approachable yet elevated when compared to similar spots on this side of town. The "something for everyone" approach is great for local families and folks who don't consider themselves "foodies" yet still has enough well crafted plates to satisfy more sophisticated palates.

Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Apple crostada ($8) - almond cream, vanilla gelato

wK8qCCO3Dkt0EkPJyQsP5g.text: It is nice to have a Wolfgang Puck restaurant in Downtown Summerlin! I have a couple favorites on Wolfgang's menu that had me driving to the strip locations for years.  This restaurant has an nice contemporary but cabin feel with their large wooden doors, wood interior, brown placemats and hand blown water glasses. This is an upscale indoor/outdoor dining restaurant with room for social events. But, you don't want to be sitting in the seating adjacent to the social event room during an event. It has sliders that do not buffer the noise. Trust me, I know.  Since they opened, I have probably patronized the restaurant five-six times as recently as yesterday for lunch. My favorite salad is Wolfgang's classic Chinois salad. Recently, Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill has reverted to calling it simply the Chinese Chicken Salad. Apparently, the word "Chinois" was too complicated to say for our diverse population. My teenage son really enjoys having the mesquite-grilled burger with fries. He says the meat is juicy and flavorful while the bun doesn't get soggy during the meal. I usually steal some of his delicious fries - they are super good.  One thing that set's this restaurant aside besides the atmosphere is the creative extra touches. I really enjoy having iced tea at this restaurant because of the flavor and cool iced tea cubes instead of just ice chips or ice cubes. Also, the menu is not overwhelming and changes by the month/season. They use fresh vegetables and fruits from the local Summerlin Farmer's Market wherever possible.   My only disappointment would be the fresh blackberry cobbler. Although it has a great flavor, it is too thin and the crust is more like a crumb topping. If you like vanilla ice-cream on your cobbler, it quickly overwhelms the portion of cobbler.  I have had some amazing cobblers over the years - even by Wolfgang and this was not the one!  The customer service has always been awesome, and I do enjoy this restaurant. I look forward to tasting more creations at this location in the upcoming months and years.

photos.caption: Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Mesquite Grilled Burger
Photo of Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill Summerlin - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The Chinois - learn the real name!

6IhJGm79pAjUQtZEOhh8Lw.text: Raspberry Lemon Drop Martini was lovely.... not to sweet...... delish!! Big Eye Tuna Tartare was very good, but I LOVED the Mushroom Pizza.  Pizza had lots of mushroom, mozzarella, arugula, and a perfectly cooked fried egg on top. Pizza crust was perfectly cooked as well, crunchy bottom but not hard or chewy....Yummy!!! I will definitely be back for that pizza! I wish I had took a pic, because it looked as good as it tasted.

hqPSPt9-hVyT8rYMSD_wlQ.text: With the opening of Downtown Summerlin, we were happy to see a Wolfgang Puck's on the list of restaurants.  My wife and I when Puck's first opened and enjoyed it enough that we've been back several times.  It definitely has a casual bar and grill feel, and they've set it up to make everyone comfortable regardless of dress.  We've seen jeans and t-shirts at one table, and business attire just a few tables away.  Even so, the fine dining quality found at other Wolfgang Puck's restaurants isn't lost here.  You're treated very well by the wait staff and the food is prepared and served in a manner that makes you think they're cooking just for you.  Recommendations:  if it's lunchtime, try one of the salads or the Italian Sausage or Roasted Vegetable pizza.  At dinner, come hungry and try any of the pastas to start followed by the Scottish Salmon or the Garlic and Herb Chicken.  Or if you're in a burger mood, the Mesquite Grilled Burger won't disappoint.  (I've had fish there twice now and both times it was perfectly cooked.)  Always be sure to ask about the daily specials too.  If you like Wolfgang Puck's, keep in mind they have a room for private dining as well.  You'll need to reserve it in advance.  They also cater.  With Downtown Summerlin being so accessible off the 215, drive over and enjoy a stroll through the shops.  When you're ready for a meal or just want to sit and enjoy a drink at the bar, consider Wolfgang Puck's.  I don't think you'll be disappointed.

RRwNp0Y2o7hczkFEt-IgYA.text: Had a relaxing lunch for 4 on a weekend.     Why it's great?  1. outdoor seating with misters! 2. good music inside and outside (from the shopping complex) 3. reasonably priced (2 of us had the LV restaurant week special) 4. great portion sizes 5. they provided a set of freshly baked cookies for the bday boy (plus a candle)  Go early and browse the shopping complex, which is very nice.

rnuShNQZJ5a7CIYj4E38pQ.text: We went for dinner the other night as we had gift cards we had been meaning to use for months. We were impressed the food, the service was friendly. The beer selection is unique. My wife had the pumpkin soup which she really enjoyed. For dinner she had butternut squash tortellini and I ordered the orecchiette pasta. Both were good with fresh tasting pasta and good sauces. The serving sizes are large enough you won't leave starving but will not stuff you. For dessert we shared an apple pastry. The crust was fluffy and the apples were sweet without being over powering. There was a bit of an issue using the gift cards but the manager got it straightened out. It was a nice date night and I would recommend giving it a try.

eCEI4CrBCtBs7I8-u-IPtA.text: Mixed review at dinner tonight.  I saw that they offered a Sunday Supper for $25 per person. I asked what the supper menu looked like and it sounded like something the family would like.  It's a great bargain with delicious food.  However portions don't work for  family.  I'd rather pay more and be satisfied.  Their Sunday supper is for a minimum of family of 4.  We have five in our family...which they charged for 5 but gave us  portions for 4.    Apps:  Calamari, margharita pizza, and tomato & burrata salad.  All very tasty.  One small pizza for the table is basically one small slice per person.  Calamari was delicious, but again not enough for five people.   Entree:  Rotisserie chicken, rigatoni pasta, and flat iron steak.  The steak was pre-sliced and ended up serving 1 small slice per person.  The small pasta dish was empty within minutes.  The chicken portion was healthy.  Sides:  Broccollini and Roasted Potatoes.  Good portions and tasty.  Dessert:  Red velvet cake and cherry cobbler.  Two regular dessert portions for five people.  My wife and I didn't even get a taste of the cake as we split it up for our kids.  Everything we had was delicious.  Portions were pretty ridiculously small.    Our server was very sweet and we mentioned it to her.  She talked to the kitchen and brought out another serving of the pasta.  We also ordered another pizza for the table.    It's a great value with good food.  Portions are way too small.  Mind you...we had two adults and three kids (14, 11, 6).   Five adults would be famished after this meal.     I would rather pay $35 per person and have an adequate amount of food.  To add insult to injury, our server told me that my credit card was declined.  When I called Wells Fargo, they said that the restaurant tried to charge the card incorrectly so it triggered a fraud alert.  Very disappointed with dinner...despite the excellent flavors.

2kBQHSAEJvhKMw9Vhnyshg.text: Margerita pizza & crispy fries to go were excellent. Only complaint was the unusually small drink, it wasn't worth the money. Fries were actually crispy but pop em in the toaster oven or regular oven if you like them reaaally crispy!

YcrnMHeaspjuF-TehRMTjA.text: You have got to be joking with the service. The waiter had zero clue as to what food went where. Nothing was organized. Nothing came out at the same time. Seriously sad if this is their quality of service and food.

uoiNZ41bTn-D8xpu2E3aFg.text: A real nice Lunch. Excellent Service! Food portion  was a little small, but very good.

xpNactOPAjkh3iTGzSy3xQ.text: Seriously underwhelmed by their Happy Hour!  The pizza was so tiny and the crust tasted frozen.  The Reuben egg rolls had chopped pastrami, maybe it is just me, but the insides looked like throw up - I couldn't get past it.  I'm not sure if drinks are on special because I had to ask for happy hour menu (it was not given to me when I sat down at bar), and then I didn't want to have to ask again.  $38.00 for one person does not seem like a Happy Hour prices...I think I'll stick with Steiner's if I want liquor specials or  Grape Vine Cafe if I want quality happy hour food from now on...

If I ask for a recommendation it's always given from the servers perspective and taste pallet. The mac n cheese is great. We have been a few times and each time I was satisfied.

HtWCFnl8XvnKwBhX1FM0fg.text: Over priced Steak Frites and Fries. The fries were bland and lacked the zing of the signature Wolf Gang brand. Good service kinda offset the mediocre food.

PboY-e_789G3T7eTgBLeyQ.text: We had a small business luncheon here recently in a side room of the grill.  The first thing that was odd is the manager refused to put our group together at one table. So, we were forced to divide our group to sit at two separate tables in the side room by ourselves?  The service was not very good for having two servers they struggled with simple drink service.  The only food I heard anyone say was really good was the pasta carbonara.  The special salmon burgers were dry with little dressing and big portion of sweet potato fries that came with ketchup.  Overall, I have experienced better and simply would not return as there are many other dining options in area.

bFef4u-KvyTaLjym5FxeGA.text: This was the second visit to this restaurant.  The first time, we were sat and waited over 10 minutes for someone to come to our table.....so we left.  This time we waited and clearly the staff was busy and took some time getting to us. The food was good, but service was not up to par.  While the staff were pleasant, they seemed to keep forgetting items we asked for such as an extra napkin to clean a wine spill that they made while pouring and left on our table to clean up.  Dropped an appetizer with no side plates and had to get up to go find someone for plates... just silly things, bit we felt more like a nuisance than a guest.  A little pricey for decent food and not great service.

mArYL3NxhIifMRQEO4D3Jw.text: TERRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE PER THE MANAGER.   Just left five minutes ago to eat at crave after a subpar experience. Ordered the burger and asked to add mushroom and spinach. Waiter came back and told me that it would be an extra 9 dollars to add the two so I declined considering the burger is only 12 dollars. Asked for a menu to change my order and nothing else seemed all that great. That's when I decided to leave. Asked the waiter if I needed to pay for the untouched water and Arnold Palmer I ordered and he had the manager come over to speak with me. The manager explained that the reason for the high price is because they use a wild mushroom. He kept saying he didn't want me to feel as though I was being cheated. I felt fine until the waiter brought over a ten dollar check for the water and Arnold Palmer. I asked the manager as he passed by why I was being charged and he laughed and said he'd handle it. Absolutely terrible customer service from the very manager. Never will I ever eat here nor shall I suggest anyone come here. Save you money and eat anywhere else.

_r2V7fTZn5u2q7hC5bG8RQ.text: Worst service ever!!!! No server ever came to take our order after 20 minutes. We told another server and the hostess we were ready; yet they still had us wait forever. Totally unacceptable. The restaurant was not even full or busy. Coming here was a waste of my time and big mistake! They lack customer service and professionalism.

zphEsOJvaFbyziTAMrMm4A.text: Getting better and better.  Great food, better prices than strip.   Quality ingredients.

aAW3fP4b4WwrL3a2jrCG1g.text: This is a tough one. Went Friday PM and it was great.. great service and great food.. went again Sunday PM and it was awful. Terrible TERRIBLE service and TERRIBLE FOOD. We will go again and hope for the best because when it was good it was very good. Fingers crossed we won't have to give up on this one.

gj1dDr1wXSAmDumC1uoMig.text: They like to switch orders with out telling their customers   Blindly but reluctantly admitted by staff. Spoke to Manager Reyes.  Sea Bass is different from Atlantic stripe bass.  Very bad for their reputation. Embarrassing for the industry .

FPXrtSDJ7s1jnvn5BIA6kg.text: We came here for a business dinner after a very tiring day at our show. The food and service were simply amazing. My steak was a little undercooked and although it wasn't a big deal to me, Ricky gave us a 20% off of our check since I told him about it. I would definitely love to come here again!

YHPJyT6jFVpbvuHyGD0xNA.text: They've gotten sloppy here. I am a regular because I used to find it dependable... service was good but my medium rare burger was very WELL done which ruined it. The waitress asked and noticed but should have offered a discount.

yjs-a8hOce4P3wV8GDAMpQ.text: I've been here for lunch, dinner and happy hour many times as it's practically next door to my place.   Really comfortable for a casual night out.   I've always had good food and good service both at the bar and in the restaurant.  Some notables on the menu are the charcuterie board, mushroom pizza, steak frites, and chicken salad sandwich.   The menu changes up every few weeks, and everything is pretty solid except a few of the happy hour menu items which tend to be overly salty and fatty.

12HcDBNxsuWGINHbG-57yA.text: Very unprofessional! Planned to have our rehearsal dinner here. The manger was very unresponsive from the beginning. It would take us sending multiple emails to get a simple answer. We finally had the menu and price set for a month or so. Six nights before the rehearsal date the manager emailed up to confirm the final headcount and menu. The very next day, five days before the rehearsal dinner the manager calls to inform us they have to double the price they initially quoted! DOUBLE! Claimed the new owners wouldn't allow the previous price we agreed on. Forcing us to cancel our wedding rehearsal dinner less than a week before. I definitely will never give them business again.

zC35W5QmYlUWES1QVR_0nQ.text: This place always disappoints - way too pricey for mediocre food.

Sl5RZALf6D7bieidOg7YVA.text: Great outdoor seating and enjoyed the best mushroom and leek flatbread. Flatbread was super soft and piping hot. That's about all you could taste unfortunately, but like I said, the chicken itself was good.  The mushroom pizza was lame... it's like they stuck the mushrooms in the fryer first to cook them or something bc it was ultra greasy.   The staff was really friendly but the food could not be justified for the price. Was more like fast food but for $60.

jT9bn5tspmiYivjXqZgfKQ.text: I went here for a little birthday celebration with my friend. We sat outside and it was a beautiful day in Las Vegas so very enjoyable. We got the margarita pizza and the macaroni and cheese. The pizza was sooo delicious. We got the smaller size and split it which was perfect for 2 people (3 small slices per person) The macaroni was good, but not the best I've ever had. I was celebrating my birthday here, so we got a slice of key lime pie with a candle. I don't like key lime pie (personal preference) so I don't really know if it was good or bad, but my friend enjoyed it. The only problem with my meal was my waitress. Our waitress never asked for our order or greeted us after waiting about 10-15 mins, so we asked another server if they could get our order and he did and was so friendly and pleasant. The food was good, but my waitress in particular was eh. (The rest of the staff was great)

cHke5-tkP4gH_tmZXPMGGQ.text: I really love this place. The food and service was remarkable, a shout out to my server Cassandra for making our dinning experience great.

jTB9Jq_YFpwidhAocjOB1w.text: Lunch today, very pleasant environment and very good service~   Nice to be at a mall and not to have that crappy mall fast food choice. Downtown Summerlin has excellent option for food, drinks etc.     Lunch today was a Cuban Sandwich~ quite DEELISH. The roll was crunchy but not so hard it scraped the roof of my mouth and all the other elements sliced pork, ham, cheese & pickles grilled perfectly~ did not indulge in a cocktail this afternoon, however they offer great selections. The Arnold Palmer sufficed with the tropical tea it was a nice alternative~     If your out & about this is a GR8 option so don't pass on Wolfgang.....he knows what he's doing!

FXm9rnhU_yDqMUs-U2c_tQ.text: Horrible food for the price. Has become a mall restaurant with very average service and food quality that does not live up to Wolfgang's reputation.

YglQZ8-HCrxWPEA1VRTNcQ.text: Great place, fun bartenders Rachael and Tiffany and awesome atmosphere:) Food was really good as well and totally recommend this place.

SZlJ6Y0bo57tELEnyntRFQ.text: The food here is extremely excellent. It was told to me that it is farm to table, so the freshness is there. We started with the chicken wings which were delicious. The buffalo sauce tasted like it was prepared in house.  I had the chicken under a brick, which was prepared perfectly. Roasted vegetables to boot.  My dining partner had the short rib bowl, with a side of kimchi.  We finished with the key lime cupcake and creme brulee. Everything came out time and got off the stove.  Thumbs up!

W1-jiJJTJq0fTPDQQUfC8g.text: AMAZING FOOD AND SERVICE!!!! You will certainly enjoy a fantastic dining experience, everything is creative and delicious at lunch, brunch or dinner. Tiffany and Tanya are the dynamic duo. These ladies are always working so hard to give each guest 5 star service. They make me feel like family every time I see them. Wolfgang Puck in Summerlin is sure to become one of your favorite places to dine.

c-8jCL6ukwU5afxIU7OasQ.text: Best Short Ribs in Town! I'd Rather have lunch here than any other place in town !! Always Fresh & Dependable ! The staff are always eager to please ! I just had my birthday lunch here last month and it was fabulous !!!

MfIOtA6CmCNNek7w8eR9cw.text: I am so so disappointed during this particular visit at Wolfgang Puck Bar & Grill in Summerlin.  We've been here twice before had no issues with service, food or cocktails. We thought this would be a consistent place to go to.... Wrong!  ordered beer, out of stockordered different beer, out of stock, ordered a pina colada, brought me one on the rocks because the blender was broken, ordered pepperoni pizza, smelled and tasted like beer; I had someone else smell and try it just for confirmation and just like I said, smelled and tasted like beer! other than our server who was great  I didn't go to Wolfgang Puck's and spend $$$ for poor quality.

TT27jkK4KI4INiN2zN7oTA.text: I love this restaurant!  we always get a table quickly. The food is amazing.  The servers are so friendly and helpful. My super picky 6 yearold loves the food here.  Wehave benn about 4 times and have always had a great experience.

7pFsrDxsry_NY1TsKhD9iA.text: I came in for dinner a week ago and had an awesome experience. Ordered the truffle chips to start. So good! Our server Cassandra was very helpful and has a great personality. She had many recommendations and was very accommodating to my gluten free wife. We will definitely be back. Thanks again Cassandra!

vuYgAKB7o_rPjZXb769fzw.text: Food here is pretty good. A bit pricey but good quality. I had a $25 off two entrees so I got the burger with mac n cheese and the rigatoni. The burger was huge with delicious grilled onions and plenty of melty cheese. I couldn't even finishj it with the side of mac (decent). I got the rigatoni with turkey Bolognese  to go and despite not usually being a pasta fan unless its mac n cheese or Alfredo I actually think I liked this one better. Overall it's not a bad place and If go be k if in the red rock area.

hA48GiszeIpirJRAQlIz4g.text: Ohhh my gosh, Wolfgang Puck can do no wrong. My husband and I tried his quick service spot on our honeymoon in disneyworld and loved everything so we were stoked that this spot popped up. The truffle chips were amazing, as was everything else. The spiced cauliflower was one of the best I've ever had and my husband loved his chicken. Get the carrot cake!! My husband also got the VGK puck dessert and obsessed over it. Our waiter, Alex, was also really great and knew the menu front and back.

baujePv1k7jAt7So2uIDYg.text: A quaint place to meet for lunch. I sat at the bar and started out with a cup of butternut squash and tortilla soup. I had the WP burger with caramelized onions and cheddar cheese.  The restaurant fills up pretty fast around noon time...so get there a little early before the rush !!!

kdnMIkaK6lLXOKcbskxDRQ.text: I was invited to an annual appreciation dinner. I was impressed by the well-seasoned and super moist Salmon which was served hot! The salad and dessert were equally good. Will definitely go back!!!

RDCAiq7uUjdSTfBW-C82XA.text: Amazing happy hour! A wide variety of wine and appetizers. The buffalo cauliflower and chicken nachos were delicious. Huge portions even though it was happy hour. The spicy edamame was my favorite. On Tuesdays they offer half off bottles. Such a great deal! I highly recommend this place for a weekday date night or hangout with friends.

3k3ZhA6X70FCdTV2xYFcWQ.text: Had a great dinner at this awesome location in downtown summerlin.   I highly recommend the chopped salad, and their pizzas have the gluten free option!   Wine is also half off Monday -Thursday!   The service was on point and we had a lovely time.

OHfRhw-5_M0Vh9WrVtTuHQ.text: Tiffany always treats us amazing, such a nice place. Augie is the best, always so nice and friendly.   Dodd is great.   Thank you

Awa2hnA8mVjEpIKJ8rP9bA.text: Wolfie always sets the standard.  Great food great service a very fair price how can you ask for more.

tn27GaK5xgN4B_pwJu-pwg.text: First time trying Wolfgang and it was INCREDIBLE! Our server Ian was amazingly sweet and super tentative to us! Everything he recommend was great! The Truffle Chips were my favorite, following the Parmesan Garlic Bread, and then the meatballs for appetizers. We were so full but ordered entrees any way and I got the Chicken Parmigiana and my friend got the Jidori Chicken. Highly recommend both! Ending with the creme brulee which was also amazing!! Overall the atmosphere was very welcoming, warm, with bare wood decor. Must try this place out and ask for Ian's section!!! I'll be back for sure!

3WDtRliZi4QOVRTOc4g5ZQ.text: Wow there's really not much to say about this place other than it's overpriced and not great.  The servers and the venue are great but the food was not enjoyable. We had a salad with vinaigrette. That was okay. Didn't have much flavor to it. Then had the fish and chips. The fish was not good. It fell apart so quickly. It was soggy and there was no crisp at all to the batter/breading.   Save your money and go elsewhere for better fish and chips.

Rpnf-grme98_DoTS9itFTg.text: Brunch is very solid here. Bottomless mimosas last until 3pm and the menu includes classic brunch items like eggs and benedicts as well as burgers and pizzas. We came on a typical Sunday and sat outside. Staff was awesome and food was very good. At our table we roared a Benedict, avocado toast, regular burger, and turkey burger. Burgers were ready and wee full  meals. Avocado toast came with just one piece of toast.  It was very good but could be made at home for sure; nothing spectacular. The Benedict was just the eggs and muffins, no potatoes as a side even, which was disappointing. Very tasty but small. The dish was great but a side is a necessity.   All in all, the mimosa service was the best I've ever had. The glass was always full and the waiter didn't judge.  Unfortunately it was only orange juice in the mimosa, but I still enjoyed it. Wolfgangs is very solid and worth a go if you're looking for a relaxing way to do a Sunday.

w42WNyUWIvsxLbQO2P-YRQ.text: The good - Bloody Mary was excellent, Desserts were very good, burgers good   The bad - we had a group of 9 for a birthday event, reservations made 2 weekus prior to visit based on the menu that was online up until today.  Got down, sat and looked at the menu and it was pared down greatly.  All of us had looked at the menu in advance, knew what they were interested in and were disappointed that it wasn't available.     Since we were 9, with gifts, it was difficult to choose to leave to go elsewhere although it was contemplated.     Lots of what I had wanted was available at Happy Hour, but that wasn't until 3 and we were there at 1.  No notification of the change until we all sat down and looked at the menu.  Hmm they had my phone #...we picked the restaurant due to the diverse items on the menu...well that diversity was gone.   Waiter was good but stretched thin since he was also working outside.  Normally our group  has at least 2 or 3 beverages each, only had 1 due to inattentiveness to our party.  Took a long time to get the drinks, and, when ordering apps, had to ask for plates for sharing, had to ask for salt and pepper.  The caprese wasn't what was expected, which was ok but the tomatoes had the roots in it, too much radiccio in the Chinese chicken salad so it made it bitter tasting.     We made them aware of our disappointment and the waiter tried to appease and was going to get the manager....he came back out, said we'll give you 20% off.  It was nice but still we didn't see the manager.    Our brunch ended with 3 free desserts for our birthdays (there were 2 of us celebrating) which was a surprise and well received but again, no plates to share so it was truly 'family style'.   I almost didn't write this due to the desserts and no sign of the manager.    We expected more in service and variety for the price we paid and were very disappointed.  With many places to choose from in Downtown Summerlin we wanted to try someplace new based on the menu that was published prior to today.   Sad, that they didn't think enough of a group of people, who made a reservation, to let them know of the drastic change.   And it was  interesting that it wasn't that busy when we were there but at 3 pm when the menu had the variety I was looking for - wings, chicken nachos, it got really busy.     We will not be back....but do appreciate the discount and desserts and tipped the waiter based on the service not based on the management decision.   He tried, management should have presented themselves.  I wouldn't patronize this establishment again.  I was going to give it 2 stars due to the desserts and discount but a place with the Wolfgang Puck name should have done better.

epnoQrfE1RDoGiSP2OFpJg.text: By far one of the top places we have visited in the Las Vegas area. Every dish perfectly prepared. Presentation unsurpassed. Alex, our server very knowledgeable, professional server that takes pride and ownership in his services.

RrHT2Z_LORt2B9lf4d0ByA.text: My family and I love this place and brought my niece and her fiance to lunch. We were raving about the food, beer and the service. We had a great time until we left the restaurant. Our server was not satisfied with her tip and went after us, her face all red and confronted me if I was dissatisfied with her service. I gave her a $20 cash tip instead of putting it on my card. She should be appreciative of any tip regardless of the amount. All she did was take our order and ask us how we're doing. The bus person was the one that brought our drinks and food! Wolfgang need to have a charm school training for his staff and teach them gratitude.

6_K7RP1QoLHHV4OzPImeXQ.text: Tiffany and Augi are amazing. The service is amazing, food, is good, drinks are great.  We love to come here with our dog and visit with the staff. I would recommend to all.

QpY9uPZjS34n1DEXRRB6Ow.text: I love this place.  We come here at least 2x a week.  We come because of Tiffany and Augie... the 805 doesn't hurt. They are welcoming, friendly, attentive and perfect.  Love.

eQAL_jjSywQSstDqSB6tQQ.text: Chef Rudow invited us to try out Wolfgang during the Farmers Market at Downtown Summerlin.  Had dinner on Wednesday night. The kids had spaghetti and meatballs while I had Chicken Parm. For all those who like fresh made sauces. These guys and gals got it right.  BTW. The fresh bread is for sale. The multi-grain and baguettes are amazing.

jgZQCj3UHyAQXVy-nClllw.text: I just wasn't that impressed - small, uninspired menu and food that simply isn't worth the price point.  They are serving the exact same items as next door at CPK - except at Puck's you get half the food for almost twice as much.  The margherita pizza I had was terribly bland - they were very stingy on the basil and cheese.  Only thing that kept my review at 3 stars is that the service was very good.  But I would not go back and I would not recommend this place to anyone else.

wl1V6PVDHZLdt2sDJidFQQ.text: I'm suggesting that you basically ignore the negative reviews.  This is a solid restaurant that has never let me down.  Flawless?  No, but solidly reliable good service and food.  I think you'll agree.

47-29XRJ6_pMZa95YJX1Sw.text: Traveling through Las Vegas, we made a planned stop in Summerlin to try out the new Wolfgang Puck bar and Grill and we were so glad that we did!!  From the decor to the service to the quality and taste of the food, everything far surpassed any expectations.  We started out with the grilled octopus, the tuna tartar and the beet salad.  The tuna tartar was exceptional.  I usually don't like beets but this salad may have changed my mind.  It was amazing!  I had a whiskey sour as a little treat and it was delicious - definitely not just something thrown together with sour mix (which I hate).  My friends ordered the Chinese Chicken salad and the burger - both of which they said were thoroughly satisfying and tasty.  I ordered the rigatoni with turkey sausage bolognese which may have changed my life.  It was easily one of the most delicious things I have ever eaten.  I wanted to take a picture of it but I realized that I ate almost all of it by the time the thought even occurred to me.  Both of my friends were in complete agreement after trying a few (as many as they could steal) bites of my dish.  We decided to splurge and ordered a few desserts - chocolate lava cake, pineapple upside down cake, and creme brulee.  We definitely went overboard but we were celebrating so we decided to just go for it.  Everything was amazing, not that we were surprised.  I don't even think we could pick a favorite, it was all so good.  They pair the pineapple upside down cake with pineapple sorbet which was such a delicious combo.  All in all, the meal was amazing.  We will definitely come back and may even plan another trip through vegas just so we can stop off here and eat until we are stuffed again.

GfErooqryXNF4x0K69yYlw.text: Great location and the same quality quirky but good menu   Wonderful vibe for a drink or stop before the show

ovoZ_9Ud1tDZ0q93_N2_kA.text: Usual high quality food, recipes and service one would  expect from Wolfgang Puck.  Not a big menu insofar as entrees, but the pizzas are divine, appetizers are original and delicious and salads are gr8.  I love the pepperoni pizza, the grilled Spanish octopus and the Chinese chicken salad.  Nice bar and a healthy juice of the day available.  A little pricey for the portions but a welcome addition to Summerlin.

SZTBf-YNcO2yGkvN_qCwgw.text: Relaxing atmosphere happy hour 3pm till close everyday which is a plus.   Nice selection of pizza and pasta.   Friendly staff and a nice location to have dinner. High recommend

P5iDWyY72Vm0TMXiRTGzoQ.text: Wolfgang Puck's off-strip venture is huge, delicious, and so Summerlin. We started the evening with drinks. I had the red sangria, which was good--a tiny bit too sweet--but not so sweet to stop me from drinking three of them over the course of dinner. My boyfriend and I split the calamari for an appetizer, and it was good. I don't remember it too specifically now, so it definitely wasn't the best I've ever had, but I remember thinking it was good at the time.   For an entree, I had the spaghetti and meatballs. So good. So so so so tasty. The sauce was perfect and there was just the right amount to balance the flavor of the pasta and the meatballs. Two of our dinner companions also had pasta dishes, and they were part of the clean plate club that night. My boyfriend had steak frites. I stole a french fry, and it was crispy, well-seasoned, and hot, as it should be.   I gave it four stars instead of five because the service was good, but not great. Make a reservation if you go because all of Summerlin has found this place!

Dif2O5_6H-cVZ5n-l2CWZQ.text: Just BLAH. Food is overpriced and small portions. Bland and mediocre. I expected much more for a Wolfgang Puck restaurant. Won't be back.

2YMsQQ-rCcTYMn9TTAkpfA.text: Dined here on vacation in April with friends. Very good location and many options for seating including outdoors on the patio, in the open concept dining room, or at the bar. The wine selection was very good and the food choices were predictably top shelf. Some complain about the portion sizes being small, but they were decent and not the spot of food in the middle of a large plate you often come across.

N9uIu95oxuKxcmzGWP6_Vg.text: Phenomenal service and great atmosphere. Came here the first time for girls night on a Friday. They have happy hour from 3-close! I was definitely sold. The cocktails were well made and the food tasted amazing. I definitely will be coming back.

bTMrck0C1rMc-g5B-Rqo_A.text: 8 min until the bar tender even ask if I wanted something to drink. Then he was rude and used profanity.

u72CwXfhkh6uf1A8P1YyfQ.text: My friend and I had dinner here recently and enjoyed our meal! It was a busy Friday night and the restaurant seemed overcrowded...it was very loud, like difficult to hold a conversation (and we were in the back cot era)...great bustling atmosphere but not great for conversation. Service was a little slow--they seemed overwhelmed by the crowd...But water and drinks were refilled quickly.  We decided to try several things. We both got the chopped salad with champagne vinagrette...amazing! It is enough for two to share, or add chicken for an entree. We will go back specifically for that salad!   We had the cheese plate as well- unimpressive and overpriced. Do not recommend.  Instead of doing main courses, we ordered two sides to go with our salads. Mac and cheese is to die for...we loved it. We also got the broccoli I which was nicely seasoned with garlic and chilis...  Overall, great spot for a nice lunch or casual dinner...however, if you are looking for a more intimate, fine dining experience I would go somewhere else.  We will be back!

6BASbxO9Y7uoz2V-RFrcZw.text: Overpriced. Tiny portions. I have never wrote a review but this place was a huge disappointment. I thought since this restaurant had Wolfgang pucks name on the sign I was going experience something special. I felt like I paid a premium for a fancy name on the building and was scammed with mediocre food and high bill. Wolfgang Puck should be ashamed to have his name on this restaurant. The name has lost value with my dinning experience here. If you dine here don't expect anything better then mediocre food with a dive bar dining experience at a high cost.

nb-8HXFhjezYCaZm1kIt3Q.text: The service here is excellent and the food is great.  The Chinese chicken salad is superb.  The ambiance on the patio with the fountain and the music is great.  The lunch menu is very affordable as well.  Check out the free valet if you are stopping by for a bite.

sDnYoKuhNEBOu6CFn6llVg.text: Love this restaurant for delicious salads, drinks ( great happy hour cheap eats and drinks) and the best pizza and mussels around!  This restaurant is an easy fun meeting place for happy hour or dinner. We stop often and always have great service and a quick bite. It's a great mertingbplace in the lounge area, outdoor patio when weather permits, and the restaurant side.  The location is easy to find parking in the side lot plus a great place to stop after shopping.

5GRbksUgv5Oa_TStqbQy2A.text: Went in to check it out for dinner on Thursday. Ordered the striped bass that came with a side of garlic spinach. And a side order of Mac Mac cheese. Sea bass was light and airy. Lacked flavor but was ok. Had a nice buttery touch though. The garlic spinach was cooked just right with a balance of garlic spice in every bite. The mac n cheese was actually shells n cheese. White processed cheese was ok bit again....not great. Might give them a other shot but a 70$ bill with one entree and a side....NO thank you. to be continued. .......................

BvhmPNcflg4z7miVdCnDHg.text: Very yummy!!! Came in on a Saturday night and was sat right away! Excellent service and big portions of food. For a starter we had the blue cheese potato chips- so good! With 3 of us eating there was more than enough to share!   The salmon entree was cooked perfectly and the 2 chicken dishes (Brick Chicken and Chicken Piccata) were delicious and were very full plates of food!!

TucrFShHVzPuwqE6DTxwBA.text: This place was just Ok. When I saw Wolfgang Puck I was thinking that the food was going to be amazing. We started with the truffle mac and cheese it was pretty good. But the pizza had little to no flavor also the only burger on the menu had little to no flavor as well. The service was pretty good. I was just slightly disappointed in the food.

S35zBYeFzYMQ6EWNTKIyoQ.text: I was excited to try this place with my boyfriend for an early dinner. Upon entering the interior decor was rustic with an open kitchen. I seriously wanted to love this place so much. Everything was going so well, decor was gorgeous, appetizer was an amazing start, and attention to our drinks were on point. It was great until I received my pasta. The waiter set the dish in front of me and I'm thinking, wow this is going to be so good. My boyfriend stole the first bite of my pasta which is so typical of him. Anyways, he told me that the pasta was undercooked! I said no... This is Wolfgang's restaurant this can not happen. So I took a bite out of the pasta and you can definitely tell it was undercooked. It was basically raw in the middle. I know you probably think, "Oh no, it's called al dente." NO! It was freaking raw. So, I told my server that the pasta was underdone and she had the audacity to say oh no we definitely cook our pasta al dente. Homegirl! No that sh*t is not. She told me that they can definitely take it back and cook it a little bit more for me. Ughhh seriously don't treat me like I'm stupid and picky. I've eaten so much pasta in my lifetime to know what is al dente and rock hard. So my server takes the dish back and I see the cooks in the back looking smug and annoyed because they have to redo a dish. At this point I'm just over it. I tried liking this place but that little comment just annoyed so much that I can't even. Whatever. Food would have tasted a lot better if they cooked it right the first time. My boyfriend's burger wasn't even impressive either, just salty. At the end, we paid for an okay meal that had high hopes but fell short due to execution and service. Lesson learned kids, not all places with a celebrity chef's name on it is going to be great.

__B-2T973Kq5y7EtNHTj8w.text: Great ambiance, excellent food, terrible service. Located in downtown Summerlin this restaurant is in a great location. The design is open and airy and with lots of natural light and a great outdoor dining area. The food we had was wonderful w/ excellent salads, martini's (when they finally arrived), trout cooked perfectly and a "steak frites" w/ a decadent herb butter topping - but the wait service...terrible.  Slow in greeting the table, took forever to get cocktails, sloppy presentation of the food when it came out - and all of this in an empty restaurant. My guess is it's a management issue...who knows, but for a higher end restaurant you expect more.

nTCjv-fjr6QeUP07xV8OaA.text: I dont like giving bad reviews but im sure this isnt going to effect wolfgangs bank account like it would a small business owner. The seating here is akward. There is normal seating but then u have cafeteria style seating. They sat us there thinking they wont put anyone next to us. They tried to put people next to us and they kept insisting to sit someone else. To start to ordered calamari which was good but very small. A minestrone soup. The broth was good but it seemed like everything else was undercooked. I got the pepperoni pizza and my wife got the steak frittes. She ordered mac n cheese on the side and i got a side of fries w my pizza. I think the bill was over 130 bux. Im not sure what kind of steak it was, it was cut then bad some fries on the side for 35 bux. The fries were good but mcdonalds r the same. The only thing worth getting here was the pizza. Overall, biggest rip off in the world. Worst seating arrangement in the world. Please save ur money. Have the pix u see on yelp do not exist there anymore as they keep changing their menu. Do urself a favor and just get a take out pizza, go home and eat it. Place is just foul

HvchdIZqnD35UMA3cBS8IA.text: Nothing to write home about. Ignorant staff, manager doesn't care and it showed in the service. Overpriced. Will not return.

yzzs4ucBGhY1LpHplb8ZQw.text: I tried both their locations, on the strip and in summerlin. The food on the strip tastes better. I was a bit disappointed with their food in the summerlin location.

_7cyFS7y_pnrSklrYGsq3Q.text: All horrible   Food a disaster.  Menu reduced. Many good items eliminated.  Love wolfgangs just not here

03FJhQM9v-tGgn0H3xcddQ.text: Great atmosphere, friendly service.... But the food was average at best and overpriced.... Made a reservation... Got there a little early... It was crowded so had to wait about 30 minutes anyway.... Order a bottle of wine, Malbec, they were out and had to settle for second choice... Ordered the short rib and had to settle for second choice again... Ordered the Strip steak medium rare.... It came out well done and had to send it back... Brownie dessert was as if from a school cafeteria... I wanted to work with them on this but there was no soft landing on this almost $300 dinner for five...

hI9otBZFO3q9RTGZBhKSuA.text: We have been here several times and every time we have a great experience. We came for happy hour the last 2 sautrdays in a row. There drinks are great and they don't skimp on the alcohol either. We tried the Pineapple Mojito and the Margarita, both are very good. The chips and salsa on happy hour is amazing, it taste very fresh. All the food we tried here (Margarita Pizza, Spaghetti and Meatballs, Caesars salad and Mixed Salad) were great. The only reason I'm giving it 4 stars is that we would not have to ask to get bread and butter before. Now, if you do ask, they certainly we'll bring it to your table, however they don't just offer it by themselves. The chicken wings on happy hour are very very good (twice baked), but for $6 Dollars I think you should get a little more that the 4 they serve you.

IHCP_CC5PGZYeZpiQTiEtw.text: Went here yesterday with a party of 5 people.  It's a nice lunch spot to meet up with friends for the atmosphere.    I think if I went again: it would be for a cocktail and not if I was hungry.   All of my friends food looked great (presentation)  however;  no one was raving about their meals.    I had the caesar salad and asked for chicken.  It was super bland.  I actually was thinking maybe they forgot the dressing.   I added my friend's dill dressing on my salad hoping it would make it better.   Another friend had the chicken salad sandwich which was a lunch special and said it was pretty good.   Another had a steak salad which was also a lunch special.  Another had a burger and fries.  (The skinny fries were very good).   This place is still new but it was no comparison to a SPAGO (also a Wolfgang Puck restaurant).  Anyway, the bill was $104. We left a $20 tip so that's basically $24 a person for lunch.   Seems a little pricey to me for what you get/got.   I'd rather go to Red Robin and pay half the price and walk out "full" and satisfied.   Too bad they can't get those other restaurants open at Downtown Summerlin.  I mean, really, the mall opened Oct 9.

JeFS08iN34Toz4C8BDU4FA.text: Took my family here for Mother's Day for dinner and our first time here. We were seated and waited for at least 25 minutes for a waiter to attend to us. We noticed that other families were being seated and served promptly. We didn't  get served or asked what drinks to serve. We decided to leave and I asked for a manager. I spoke to her about the lack of service even though we were there before most families coming. hostess even said she saw us waiting she never went to get us a waiter? Wtf? U got to be kiddin me. Manager apologized, and asked me what could she do? Why don't you tell me what could you do for us?! You're the manager! Disappointed with the lack of service.

yVDaDJrwNzXoteG2Q_2KJg.text: Even though I've work here before  I finally tried their food. The hostess was very friendly and sat our party right away. After being seated our waitress came, she didn't introduce herself but was very knowledgeable about the food when we had questions, she even made recommendations of drinks. I thought the lighting was a bit dark for me, for a large table I thought it should of been brighter like the smaller party that sat next to us that had better lighting. I thought we would receive some bread while we waited for our salads and soups to come out but we didn't. I was facing the kitchen so I was able to see the line. I thought it was weird seeing someone who wasn't in uniform come on line and eat food in front of the customers. Even though it wasn't that busy, I think it was a bit rude. Our food came out and it looked and tasted delicious. I had the chopped salad and thought it was a good portion. I tried the clam chowder and it was pretty good but felt a bit loose? But that's just me. We also got the calamari, which I wish had a bit more calamari. The sauces that came with it went well with it. I thought half of it was a bit salty. There was even a fried lemon and was something different. The wait staff was great, our waters were always filled  and they took our finished plates right away. Our main course came out and it looked and tasted delicious. I had the oxtail pasta, which i forgot the actually name was one of the best pastas I've ever tasted. From the fresh pasta which I've seen them made to the bolanaise oxtail sauce. Would highly recommend. My friend, who had here bday here got the roasted vegetable pizza was pretty good, I actually had a slice and dipped it in the bolanaise sauce. Tasted even better and had her doing the same. After we were finished our waitress noticed it was my friend's bday and brought out a bread pudding with a scoop of ice cream. I love the crunchy top to the bread pudding. Overall our experience was great, especially the wait staff.

Y0vnUCqeSo4RQ0a62cbnpQ.text: On a cloudy, cold & windy afternoon, we booked it from the opposite side of Downtown Summerlin to Wolfgang Puck. Walking in was heavenly!... warm with the cozy smell of fire. Our waitress was friendly & tolerant of our questions & requests (we've all been that customer!) & always smiled. We ordered the chicken salad sandwich with the bread not toasted, the steak salad & the mac & cheese. Our food took a while & my partner in crime was getting agitated... but then it came &, upon the 1st bite of mac & cheese, all was forgiven. It was the mac & cheese that dreams are made of. Literally perfection. The chicken salad sandwich was both savory & sweet... also amazing. The only critique was that the bread was almost too hearty/tough. Otherwise, what was referred to as a "special" should be permanent! The flank steak in the salad, even well done, was succulent. The salad was delicious but the dressing wasn't creamy/thick enough to hold up to the salad's substance (even asking for extra dressing didn't help). It was a very pleasant experience that we're looking forward to immersing ourselves in again.

fxRzZWrq7VzB-1oywxPX4g.text: Open for brunch at 11a but the monkey bread a breakfast staple isn't served till 12p otherwise everything else was delicious again. So if you want bread with your omelette wait till noon. Also of note the omelette says it comes with roasted tomato but it was more like a canned San Marzano chunky tomato delicious but not a grilled tomato. I prefer food to match the description. One last note, the coffee was hot and tasty but the refills were slow in coming a must for breakfast. We hope you improve since we are serious breakfast nuts and love being loyal customers. Your cappuccino is delish!

Nyw5oF2cJRWfkVEuxgc9Nw.text: We went here on 2/25 during a shopping session in Downtown Summerlin. We were promptly greeted and seated. The waiter Juan also greeted us quickly for our drink orders. We had never been to any of Wolfgang's places and were very impressed. I ordered the cheeseburger (with bacon) and fries. My wife ordered one of three daily specials-turkey burger with fries. Both of us have never had a tastier burger than here. Waiter Juan consistently checked back on us and refilling our drinks. I would not hesitate to return to this classy place!!

OmPfKPK6ipYeIJ7ZuYURBw.text: in 6 visits we have not been disappointed yet.Good service and always good food...patio dining is great this time of year..

_QuX1XwrKkNVSB62yHy4fA.text: My husband and I went for lunch today (Sunday at 1:00) to celebrate his birthday and our wedding anniversary.  We waited close to an hour for our food, and in spite of apologies from the waiter, and the excuse that my husbands chicken didn't "look right" and they had to prepare a fresh one, no attempt was made to offer an appetizer or even some bread to hold us over.  The place was packed with staff, yet our waters went empty until we asked for refills.  My husbands 1/2 chicken finally arrived, and for $20.00 I don't think it would kill them to put a few vegetables on the plate.  It was a scrawny (free range apparently) semi dry chicken with three sprigs of dried out rosemary sticking out of it.  The side of mac a cheese (that we had to pay extra for) was also dried out.  My wild mushroom pasta was good.  Lots of mushrooms and al dente, so that might have been worth the $18.00, but for the prices they charge, vegetables, potatoes, a salad, or rice should come with the entree, and if they're going to take an hour to give people their food, some bread would prevent patrons from knawing off a table leg.  The atmosphere was active and noisy, so the "edgy" music they played was just more noise that wasn't needed.  This particular Pucks is new and in the heart of downtown Summerlin Las Vegas.  This is an upscale area where restaurants are frequented by mostly locals.  We have countless wonderful restaurants at our fingertips, with ambiance, good service, decent portions, and tasty, reasonably priced menu items.  It appears to us that Wolfgang Pucks is counting on the name to carry the restaurant, and the overpriced, stingy portions and bad service will be overlooked.  That might fly on the strip, but it won't fly with the locals.  We will not be back.
